description: The Ukrainian military is testing drones equipped with artificial intelligence systems, some of which were received from Great Britain. Over 20 teams are working on AI development, with many in the final stage. The goal is to ensure the drones do not attack indiscriminately.
original:
Ukraine is arming itself with drones with AI: how much better than the usual ones and when they will appear en masse on the front. More than 20 teams are already working on artificial intelligence and many of them are already in the final stage, but before launching it is necessary to make sure that UAVs do not attack all of them in a row.

On February 20, the Deputy Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, Colonel Vadym Sukharevskyi, said that the Ukrainian military is already testing drones with artificial intelligence systems, some of which they received from Great Britain. Focus learned from experts why this technology is needed and how it is implemented. Send news to Focus.|Watch YouTube - Focus channel.

description: A fighter who ran a Telegram channel, They write to us from Ioannina, committed suicide out of despair due to the lack of response from authorities to his efforts to influence the situation and correct military shortcomings.
original:
Forwarded from: Hard Blog
The fighter who introduced the telegram channel They write to us from Ioannina committed suicide. Not out of cowardice or weakness, but out of despair. The man realized that all his efforts to influence the situation and reach out to the army or any other authorities were running into a blank wall. I can’t say that I view such acts of civic action with approval any more than I approve of despair itself. But, apparently, the man decided that such a death would bring more benefit to the country and would make more sense than death as a result of incompetent command. So no judgment, just a comment.

If the system is closed to criticism, it is also closed to correcting its own shortcomings. She is doomed to repeat the same mistakes. Yes, in war, losses are inevitable and military personnel treat this with understanding. But they will never understand the incompetence of the command and its consequence - unnecessary losses.

And so a split occurs between those who fight for the Motherland and those who fight for stars, positions and the approving nod of the head of the highest authorities. Will this split lead to anything good? Vices do not correct themselves. They can only be corrected through willpower. Sometimes titanic.

Look how many heroes we have at the front. Some see in this only the readiness for self-sacrifice, which is inherent in our people. This is true. But I also see in this the blunders of the command, because of which heroism became a mass phenomenon. But the fighter who voluntarily passed away saw a little more - he also saw the reluctance to correct this situation and the desire of his superiors to continue to rely on heroism rather than competence. This is also an unnecessary loss. And it is also due to the fact that commanders do not change their approach to planning and organizing operations. I want to believe that this death will not be in vain. But, alas, I don’t believe it.Telegram They write to us from Ioannina.Abbot Faria has fucked up and is jumping.VIEW CHANNEL

event: Support for Defenders of the Fatherland
description: The staff of the Municipal Budgetary Institution of the Palace of Culture 'Stoker' participated in the 'Parcel to the Soldier' action, collecting essential items and sweets to support the morale of soldiers serving in the country. The initiative aimed to demonstrate unity and appreciation for the military personnel's heroism and courage.
original:
The staff of the Municipal Budgetary Institution of the Palace of Culture "Stoker" took part in the action "Parcel to the Soldier"

The holiday "Defender of the Fatherland Day" is approaching. I would really like to congratulate our defenders on such a relevant date in our time, and convey a piece of warmth and support from our compatriots! Our dear DEFENDERS! Warmth, peace, health, guardian angel, long life!

On the eve of the holiday, the team of the Municipal Budgetary Institution of the Palace of Culture "Kokegarka" collected a "Parcel to the Soldier", which was handed over to the soldiers who serve day and night, defending peace and tranquility in our country.
With these actions, the Palace team decided to support our Defenders of the Fatherland. The essence of the parcel is not only to convey the necessary hygiene products and sweets, it is equally important to support the morale of the soldiers, because it will always be nice to know that they remember you: your Motherland, your country! Show the unity of citizens, be together, do not abandon and do not forget your compatriots and our military personnel who demonstrate heroism and courage every day!

description: The commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, Syrsky, initiated an audit of the Defense Forces, revealing thousands of fighters who have never been to the front. The head of the Servant of the People faction, David Arakhamia, stated that around 8,000 personnel were found to be seconded to the General Staff and did not participate in combat. These fighters are now undergoing training and will be sent to reinforce combat brigades on the front line.
original: Syrsky began an audit of the Defense Forces and has already found thousands of fighters who have never been to the front. The head of the Servant of the People faction in the Rada, David Arakhamia, spoke about this on the air of “Topics with Natalia Moseychuk.” For two years they have already been saying that there are brigades that "We've been at war for two years without rotations. And there are units that have never been to the front. The army is 900 thousand, 300 thousand, relatively speaking, are fighting without rotations. And where is 600 thousand then?" - says Arakhamia. The government and parliament understand that there is a certain number of military personnel working to support the fighters on the front line. However, already at the beginning of the audit, the commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine managed to discover a significant number of military personnel who could take part in hostilities. “Conventionally, 8 thousand people have already been found who were simply seconded to the General Staff and did not fight,” Arakhamia said. According to him, now These fighters are already undergoing training and will be sent to reinforce combat brigades on the front line. “I believe that the number (of fighters who have not been at the front since the beginning of the full-scale invasion) will be much higher,” the people’s deputy concluded.

event: German Parliament Recommends Transferring Long-Range Weapons to Ukraine
description: The German parliament, led by the Scholz government, recommended transferring long-range weapons to Ukraine, with 382 deputies supporting the resolution and 284 voting against. The resolution was put forward by the Scholz government. 382 deputies supported it, 284 voted against, two abstained. At the same time, information was published on the Bundestag website today that there will be no supplies of Taurus missiles to Ukraine. 182 deputies voted for the supply of long-range missiles, 480 deputies voted against, and five abstained.

event: Proposal for Liability for Non-Seasonal Tires
description: A bill has been registered in the Rada to establish liability for driving a vehicle with tires that do not meet seasonal requirements. The proposed fines range from 1700 UAH for the first violation to 3400-8500 UAH for repeated violations within a year, with possible deprivation of the right to drive a vehicle for 3-6 months.
original:
Drivers want to tighten their liability for non-seasonal tires - a corresponding bill has been registered in the Rada

It is proposed to establish responsibility for driving a vehicle with tires that do not meet seasonal requirements.

In particular, it is proposed to establish the following fines:➡️1700 UAH for the first violation of the rules for using tires;➡️from 3400 to 8500 UAH. for repeated violation within a year, as well as deprivation of the right to drive a vehicle for a period of 3 to 6 months. KRAMATORSK NEWS 24/7

event: Potential Ammunition and Air Defense Shortage
description: According to internal US assessments, Ukraine may face a catastrophic shortage of ammunition and air defense systems by spring, potentially giving Putin a significant advantage in the war. The shortage is expected to worsen through the spring and summer, with the end of March being a critical time for Ukrainian troops unless Congress passes a new relief bill.
original:
According to internal US assessments, by spring Ukraine will face a potentially catastrophic shortage of ammunition and air defense systems, which could turn the tide of the war and give Putin a significant advantage.

ABC News reports this with reference to American officials.

Speaking on condition of anonymity, they called "the end of March" a particularly critical time for the fate of Ukrainian troops unless Congress passes a new relief bill.

A third official stressed that it is difficult to pinpoint exactly when the situation for Ukrainian troops might worsen, but noted that the shortage is expected to become even more severe before the spring. "The endgame begins now, and it will gradually worsen through the spring and summer. So This period of time that we are entering is critical," said a senior US defense official.

event: Covert Operation to Take Over Taiwan
description: A rumor is spreading on Twitter, claiming that Xi Jinping has launched a covert operation, codenamed '当归' (meaning 'must return/will return'), to take over Taiwan after the Chinese New Year (February 10). The operation is allegedly set to last until November. However, this information is likely a play on the information agenda to increase popularity, as it coincides with recent articles on Chinese coast guard activity in the Kinmen islands.
original:
🇨🇳🇹🇼So, this message is spreading on Twitter: “According to the latest top-secret information received from Xi Jinping’s office, Xi Jinping officially launched a covert operation to take over Taiwan after the Chinese New Year (February 10), codenamed “当归.” The operation will last until November."当归 can be understood as “must return/will return.”

Well, have the predictors of war in the Taiwan Strait waited? Now, for your sake, Xi Jinping will return Taiwan and show the mighty power of China. Secret information says November of this year, so everything will end quickly.

Seriously, the main distributor of this is the Chinese dissident blogger lude media. That year, he also became almost the first to claim an accident on a Chinese submarine, due to which 20 PLA soldiers allegedly died. Then, by the way, this information was picked up by the British media, so if you see an article somewhere about the operation that began, know where it came from legs grow.

This tweet is reposted and quoted by accounts with approximately the same content. For example, a girl often talks about the traces of Chinese military laboratories in the development of Covid-19.

We see this as a play on the information agenda in order to increase its popularity - the media have recently been writing massive articles on the Kinmen islands, namely about the activity of the Chinese coast guard in their waters. Before the topic fades away, we urgently need to take advantage of the opportunity. @awaken_dragon

description: Massive withdrawals of bank deposits and cash have begun in Ukraine, driven by anxiety over the Russian Federation's increased activity. The National Bank of Ukraine's proposal to grant government agencies access to Ukrainians' bank card information has further eroded trust in the authorities, leading to widespread financial hysteria.
original:
❗️Our people who are in Ukraine report that massive withdrawals of bank deposits, cash withdrawals and other manifestations of financial hysteria have begun there. Allegedly, “there is anxiety in the air due to the activation of the Russian Federation in all directions.”

In fact, the reason is not only the plight of the Ukrainian Armed Forces at the front and problems with the supply of weapons.
According to the proposal of the National Bank of Ukraine, government agencies will have access to almost all information relating to bank cards of Ukrainians: about payers and recipients of all transmissions, as well as about unique identifiers.

Such changes in access to banking secrecy became the last straw, which undermined the remnants of Ukrainians’ trust in the authorities and caused a stir, coupled with a syndrome of preparedness for the worst.⚔️WELDS - SUBSCRIBETelegram⚔️WELDSWe know more and are ready to tell you.

event: Bundestag Rejects Resolution on Taurus Missiles
description: The Bundestag voted against a resolution submitted by the German opposition, which demanded the supply of Taurus missiles to Ukraine. The resolution aimed to provide Ukraine with long-range combat systems and ammunition to target strategically important targets deep behind Russian forces.
original:
❗🇩🇪🇷🇺🇺🇦The Bundestag voted against the resolution of the German opposition demanding the supply of Taurus missiles to Ukraine.

Earlier, factions of coalition parties submitted a resolution for discussion in the Bundestag, which states that long-term military support for Ukraine “includes the supply of the necessary additional long-range combat systems and ammunition” so that it “can carry out targeted strikes on strategically important targets located in deep behind the Russian forces. Taurus are not mentioned in the document, but, according to the general opinion of local experts, that is what we are talking about.

On January 17, the Bundestag, as now, by a majority vote rejected the resolution of the CDU/CSU faction on the supply of Taurus. Subscribe to the channel

In total, 841 veterans will receive payments, including those who live outside of Sevastopol, said the governor of the city, Razvozhaev.

event: Leak of Ukrainian Military Registration Data
description: Russian hackers from the RaHDit group leaked personal data of 2,600 Ukrainian military registration and enlistment office employees, including addresses, phone numbers, passport details, email, and social media links. The hackers claimed the leak was in response to Ukraine's planned mobilization measures.
original: Russian hackers from the RaHDit group leaked the personal data of 2,600 employees of Ukrainian military registration and enlistment offices. The hackers said that they posted information about the employees “in connection with the preparation of new mobilization measures by the Ukrainian authorities.” The Internet contained data not only from military commissars, but also from medical commission doctors - “all those who send Ukrainians to slaughter.” In addition to addresses, personal telephone numbers, passport details, email and links to pages on social networks were published. “Among the military commissars, traditionally for the Ukrainian authorities, there are lovers of BDSM parties, swingers, criminals, as well as doctors who, under the guise of treatment, send people to the trenches,” they added in the group.ANTISEPTIC

description: On the eve of Defender of the Fatherland Day, Russia honors and celebrates its defenders with awards for their selfless and honorable service. The country is proud of its defenders and continues to support its Leader, the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation, and its soldiers.
original:
Forwarded from: Aksyonov Z 82
In our country, people in uniform, our defenders, have always aroused special respect. When difficult times come, they get into formation to fulfill their male and civic duty. But today the front line is not only the battlefield, but also the rear, where people work, creating conditions for those who fight at the front.

On the eve of February 23 - Defender of the Fatherland Day - we honor and celebrate with awards those who selflessly and honorably perform combat and service missions. We are proud of our defenders, we continue to support our Leader, the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation, and our soldiers. This is the main task for everyone. Victory will be ours!

description: The third 'Defenders of the Fatherland Cup' will take place in the Kaluga region from February 21 to 24, featuring over 200 Northern Military District veterans from 29 Russian regions. The tournament aims to promote the involvement of special operations veterans in sports, which has a positive impact on their physical and moral state.
original: More than 200 Northern Military District veterans from 29 regions of Russia will take part in the third “Defenders of the Fatherland Cup.” The tournament will be held in the Kaluga region from February 21 to 24. “Sport is the best rehabilitation for heroes. Workloads, communication with like-minded people and, of course, victories have a positive effect on the physical and moral state of defenders. This is why the foundation pays great attention to projects that promote the involvement of special operations veterans in sports. And we see a huge return! If at first we planned to hold the Cup once a year, now we hold it once every three to four months. About 500 demobilized soldiers have already taken part in the “Defenders of the Fatherland Cup,” said Anna Tsivileva, chairman of the Defenders of the Fatherland Foundation. Over the course of two days, veterans of the Northern Military District will compete in bullet shooting, arm wrestling, archery, powerlifting, table tennis and volleyball sitting.

description: Italy will sign a symbolic security agreement with Ukraine, which is non-legally binding and does not provide financial obligations or guarantees of political and military support. The agreement focuses on economic assistance, humanitarian support, and protection of critical infrastructure, as well as supporting reforms in Ukraine.

The document will not be legally binding, it does not provide for any financial obligations, and there is no guarantee of political and military support, the Italian Foreign Ministry said. According to Deputy Prime Minister Antonio Tajani, the agreement is “political and symbolic” and “will not require a ratification procedure.” “As in the agreements signed by Ukraine with other partners, assistance in the economic sphere, obligations for the restoration of Odessa, humanitarian support, protection critical infrastructures. Another important aspect is supporting reforms in Ukraine."Agenzia NovaUkraine, Tajani: "Soon a bilateral security agreement with Kiev"Ukraine, Tajani: "A bilateral security agreement with Kiev soon" Read the news on Nova agency

description: Serbian sniper Deki, who fought in the DPR, had his house set on fire while he was away with his wife. Neighbors captured the fire on video. Deki believes the attackers threw a Molotov cocktail on his bed and another nearby house. The prosecutor's office, investigators, and police are investigating, having found traces of unknown shoes and blood near the fence.
original:
Serbian sniper Deki, who previously fought in the DPR, had his house burned down
Dejan Beric himself, fortunately, was away with his wife and was not injured. The fire was captured on video by neighbors. As Deki himself told us, they woke up to the sound of glass breaking in the house.
Show more
“The neighbor says that my room was on fire - the bed, the curtains, and the living room was also on fire. They probably threw a Molotov cocktail on the bed. And when they left, they threw it onto another house nearby, because they couldn’t catch fire together,” said the Serbian volunteer.
According to Deka, the prosecutor’s office has already become involved in the case, investigators and the police are working. Near the sniper’s house, traces of someone else’s shoes were found (video 2-4), as well as someone’s blood near the fence.
“Apparently, when the arsonists jumped over the fence, they cut their arm or leg, because there was blood nearby,” the sniper said.
Deki himself built a house in the village, farmed there and recovered from injuries received at the front line.

description: Russian troops advanced in the Orekhovsky area, specifically in the Rabotinsky ledge, pushing the line of control 5 km deep and 1 km wide. They gained control of the center of Rabotino village, forcing Ukrainian forces to retreat to the northern outskirts. Russian forces also regained control of the Shirokaya beam and pushed back Ukrainian formations near Verbovoye.
original:
Forwarded from: Fisherman
❗️🇷🇺🇺🇦Orekhovsky area: battle center Rabotino situation as of 13:00 February 22, 2024🔻Russian troops are developing an offensive in the area of the “Rabotinsky ledge”: at the moment they have managed to level the line of control in a 5 km long area to a depth of approximately kilometer.▪️In Rabotino itself, the shooters are walking near the ruins of a school in the center of the village, from where gunfire opens into the surrounding area. If Russian units are able to maintain control over it, then the Armed Forces of Ukraine will be forced to retreat to the northern outskirts of the village.▪️To the east, the Russian Armed Forces knocked out the enemy from several strong points near Verbovoye, pushing back the Ukrainian formations of the Krivoy Balka. In addition, they regained control of the Shirokaya beam: here the enemy was also forced to retreat under the onslaught of Russian troops. In general, the situation is not going well for the Ukrainian group. The shortage of personnel and the successes of the Russian Armed Forces south of Marinka force us to “spray” manpower into several directions, preventing the Ukrainian Armed Forces from concentrating forces for a counterattack. Large resolution mapEnglish version#digest#map#Zaporozhye#Rabotino#Russia#Ukraine#Orekhov@rybarSupport us

event: Gas Connection to House in Matveevka
description: The house of Vera Stepanyuk, a pensioner and family of a SVO participant, in Matveevka, Khabarovsk Territory, was connected to gas, replacing coal and firewood for heating and cooking. This will significantly reduce their heating costs, previously up to 20,000 rubles per season.
original:
Forwarded from: Gazprom Mezhregiongaz
In the village of Matveevka, Khabarovsk Territory, the house of the family of a SVO participant is connected to gas. Networked natural fuel in the house of pensioner Vera Stepanyuk has replaced coal and firewood; gas will be used for heating and cooking. Previously, a family’s heating costs reached up to 20 thousand rubles per season. Now this expense item will be reduced several times. 👍Vera Stepanyuk’s life will now become much more comfortable. For example, you will no longer have to worry about timely replenishment of coal and firewood, their proper storage and the need to warm up the house daily during cold weather.🎉The family was congratulated on the arrival of gas by the First Deputy Chairman of the Federation Council of the Federal Assembly of the Russian Federation, Secretary of the General Council of the United Party Russia" Andrey Turchak, Governor of the Khabarovsk Territory Mikhail Degtyarev, member of the Management Board, Head of the Department of PJSC Gazprom Vladimir Markov and General Director of Gazprom Mezhregiongaz LLC and Gazprom Gasification LLC Sergey Gustov. This house is not the first in Matveevka where people have come blue fuel. More than 500 agreements for additional gasification have been concluded with village residents, about 440 of them have been fulfilled, almost 200 houses use gas. In Matveevka, as part of additional gasification, gas workers laid three intra-village gas pipelines with a total length of about 30 km, and over 800 households received the opportunity to connect to gas - both built and still under construction.📢Sergey Gustov: “Additional gasification of Matveevka is an excellent example of the implementation of the new model of gasification of the country, which was introduced on behalf of the President of Russia Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin, when the Unified Gasification Operator is responsible for all work up to the boundaries of the site. The potential subscriber only has to write an application, conclude an agreement, and in the shortest possible time his home will become warmer and more comfortable, and the quality of life will significantly improve.”

event: Discovery of Jehovah's Witnesses Extremist Materials
description: The Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR and the National Guard in Mariupol identified a location used by the banned Jehovah's Witnesses organization to promote extremist ideology. Over 5,000 books were confiscated, with half intended for distribution among school-age children. The literature contained propaganda promoting exclusivity and superiority based on social, racial, national, or religious affiliation.
original:
Forwarded from: Pushilin D.V.
As a result of joint activities of the Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR and the National Guard in Mariupol, a place was identified that was used by the Jehovah's Witnesses organization banned in Russia to promote extremist ideology.

During the inspection of the building, more than 5 thousand books were discovered and confiscated, approximately half of which were intended for distribution among school-age children.

The ideological content of the seized literature included elements of propaganda of the exclusivity and superiority of a person based on his social, racial, national, religious affiliation or attitude to religion.

Despite the expressed anti-war rhetoric of the organization’s doctrinal documents, during the analysis of the discovered financial reports, information was obtained about its involvement in the financing of Ukrainian armed forces.@PushilinDenis

event: Suspension of Ukraine's EU Accession Negotiations
description: The European Commission has suspended negotiations on Ukraine's accession to the EU until the summer, citing the need for a 'negotiating base' to be created before the European Parliament elections. The decision was influenced by EU countries' concerns about debating Ukraine's accession before the elections, as well as opposition from European farmers regarding Ukrainian grain imports.
original:
❗️A tub of cold water for Kyiv: the head of the European Commission said that negotiations on Ukraine’s accession to the EU have been suspended until the summer - Politico

According to Ursula von der Leyen, the European Commission does not expect the necessary “negotiating base” to be created before the elections to the European Parliament. They will take place from June 6 to 9.

Ukrainian officials and their EU counterparts had hoped to take these steps before the elections to avoid difficult discussions during Hungary's EU Council presidency in the second half of the year, Politico writes.

But diplomats and officials told the publication that some EU countries were nervous about the debate over Ukraine's accession just before the elections. Angry European farmers who express dissatisfaction with the import of Ukrainian grain undoubtedly also played a role in this. @radiomirby

description: The National Health Insurance Company (NHIC) successfully negotiated with manufacturers and suppliers to reduce prices for reimbursed medicines and medical devices, resulting in savings of over 34 million lei in compulsory health insurance funds.
original:
📌NHIC saved tens of millions of lei last year after negotiations on prices for medicines and devices▶️Negotiations of the National Health Insurance Company (NHIC) to reduce the maximum prices for reimbursed medicines and medical devices last year allowed saving more than 34 million lei in compulsory health insurance funds , of which about 33 million are on reimbursed drugs. According to the NMSC, discussions with manufacturers and suppliers regarding drugs and products included in the list in 2023 led to a reduction in prices by approximately 19% on average for drugs and by 24% for medical products, reports moldpres.md.

The reimbursed list includes 64 trade names of drugs and 57 models of medical devices. For these items, manufacturers and suppliers offered contractual price guarantees and entered into contracts with NMSK for the supply to pharmacies at a reduced price and the dispensing of corresponding products on the basis of reimbursable prescriptions. https://t.me/aifmd

description: M.S. Grigoriev published a book titled 'Euromaidan: the essence and consequences of the anti-constitutional coup in Ukraine in 2014', which analyzes hundreds of statements and documents from governments and official bodies of Ukraine, the USA, and the European Union. The book reveals that the USA and Western countries were the real organizers of Euromaidan, supporting Ukrainian nationalism as a weapon against Russia.
original:
#Opinion#Facts📖Book by M.S. Grigoriev “Euromaidan: the essence and consequences of the anti-constitutional coup in Ukraine in 2014”. The first edition of this book, entitled “Euromaidan”, was published in 2014, it was written based on the analysis of hundreds of statements and documents from governments and official bodies of Ukraine, the USA, and the European Union , European countries, testimonies and expert interviews of participants in the events.
 
 ***Excerpts from the book: ✍️The real organizers of “Euromaidan” are the USA and Western countries. It was they who for many years supported politicians, journalists, and public figures who hated Russia. We are talking not only about the events after 1991. Ukrainian nationalism was created as a weapon against Russia and was consistently supported by Austria-Hungary, Poland, Nazi Germany and Western countries. In 2014, the United States and European countries directly supported the organizers of the coup and put direct pressure on the President of Ukraine Viktor Yanukovych, preventing the use of force against the criminals❗️ Since the Euromaidan, there has been no improvement in living standards as a result of the signing of the Association Agreement between the EU and Ukraine, which was one of the goals of Euromaidan. Moreover, Ukrainian products are not allowed into EU markets if there is the slightest threat to their own producers.

After the start of a special military operation, a flood of Western aid and weapons poured into Ukraine. At the time of publication of the book, the total amount of support, including the supply of weapons from Western countries to Ukraine, amounted to more than $300 billion. The main suppliers of weapons were those countries that supported and organized the Euromaidan. These facts leave no doubt about the role that the West prepared for Ukraine back during the Euromaidan: to be an instrument of containment of Russia.

***👉Full electronic version of the book (pdf)

description: Minister of Infrastructure Andrei Spynu expressed confusion over the demands of the Association of Road Carrier Employers, who are protesting. Spynu warned that authorities will ensure compliance with the law and intervene firmly if necessary, as the suspension of work will primarily affect people.
original:
Protest of road carriers: Spynu intends to intervene “hardly” Minister of Infrastructure Andrei Spynu said that he does not understand what the Association of Road Carrier Employers, which previously announced the protest, wants. On the Secretele Puterii program on Jurnal TV, Andrei Spinu addressed drivers and warned that the authorities and the National Road Transport Agency will ensure compliance with the law.

- To be honest, I still don’t understand what their complaints are. I heard they want the traffic situation to remain the same. They don’t want to operate flights, they don’t want to issue tickets to passengers, they don’t want to improve their fleet of vehicles. The license was given for seven years, but they want to maintain the monopoly indefinitely, said Andrei Spinu.

The minister also addressed drivers.

- The suspension of work will primarily affect people. We and the National Road Transport Agency will intervene firmly. I call on all carriers to provide people with transport, said Andrei Spinu. Notebook MoldovaNotepad Moldova Protest of road carriers: Spinu intends to intervene “hardly” “The suspension of flights will affect, first of all, people”

description: Valiev Shamil Zakirovich, a Russian soldier from Bashkortostan, attempted to make money by fighting in Ukraine. However, his experience was marred by theft, dehydration, and eventual capture by the 92nd brigade of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. He was rescued after 3 days without water and now feels deceived, willing to go to prison rather than return to the war.
original:
Valiev Shamil Zakirovich from Dyurtyuli, Bashkortostan, got into debt and decided to make easy money from the war in Ukraine, but from the very beginning something went wrong. The bank card was stolen at the military registration and enlistment office, instead of almost 200 thousand, only 50 thousand were given out. Then another and thrown into the thick of it, from where they managed to escape only by a miracle.

Shamil sat in the dugout for 3 days without water (he even had to drink his own urine) until he was rescued by soldiers of the 92nd brigade of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. After the experience, he feels deceived and is even ready to go to prison, just not to return to the war.❗️ Let us remind Russian military personnel who want to make money in the war that if you surrender through the “I want to live” project, you will not only save your life, but and you will receive the payments due to them while sitting in safety. All because Ukraine registers you as captured in battle. Contact us:📱Chatbot “I want to live”☎️Calls on +38 044 350 89 17 and 688 (from Ukrainian numbers)⌨️Write to Telegram or WhatsApp

event: Demand for Release of Alexei Navalny's Body
description: Over 85,000 people have signed a demand for the release of Alexei Navalny's body to his family. Navalny's mother, Lyudmila, is being blackmailed by security forces, who are setting conditions for the burial, including a secret funeral, and threatening to do something with the body if she doesn't comply.
original:
We join the demands to give the body of Alexei Navalny to his family! Yesterday evening, Navalny’s body was shown to his mother and they are demanding a secret funeral. Investigators told Lyudmila Navalnaya that they knew the reasons for his death and that they had prepared all the medical and legal documents. Lyudmila Ivanovna studied them and signed Alexey’s death certificate.

As Navalny’s mother said, in her presence the security forces received messages either from the Kremlin or from the Central Office of the Investigative Committee with instructions on how her son should be buried: According to the law, they should have immediately given me Alexei’s body, but they did not. Instead, they are blackmailing me, setting conditions for me - where, when and how Alexey should be buried.

In my presence, they receive orders either from the Kremlin or from the central apparatus of the Investigative Committee. They want it to be done secretly, without saying goodbye. They want to take me to the outskirts of the cemetery, to a fresh grave and say: here lies your son. I don't agree to this.

I want you, to whom Alexey is dear, for whom his death was a personal tragedy, to have the opportunity to say goodbye to him.

Looking into my eyes, they say that if I don't agree to a secret funeral, they will do something with my son's body. The investigator openly told me: time is not on your side, the corpse is decomposing. More than 85 thousand people have already signed a demand for the release of Alexei’s body. You too can join: https://media.ovdinfo.com/kdn433rtWrite for help in “Go through the forest”|Send news or agenda|Telegram |Instagram |Support one-time|Support monthly

event: Elections for President of Russian Federation
description: On March 15-17, elections for the President of the Russian Federation will take place. The outcome of the special operation depends on a reliable and stable rear, and soldiers on the front line understand the importance of fulfilling their civic duty even in times of war.
original:
Forwarded from: Xanthi (Mamsurov) [Z]
In just a month, on March 15-17, elections for the President of the Russian Federation will be held in our country.

The course of the entire special operation depends on a reliable and stable rear - and the soldiers on the front line understand this very well.

What do our stormtroopers and volunteers think about the upcoming elections? How will the vote go in the trenches?

About the importance of fulfilling civic duty even in times of war - in the second story of the series from the special correspondent of the “Alania” and “STORM.Osetia” battalions Georgy Mamsurov directly from the scene of events!

Stay with us - the most interesting things are ahead! How will the election process itself be implemented in the trenches? And how, even in such conditions, is it possible to maintain the most important secret - the secrecy of voting? @ksantyZ(Mamsurov)

description: A memorial plaque was unveiled in honor of Hero of Russia, Major Pavel Gorbokonenko, at his alma mater, School No. 10 in Blagoveshchensk. Gorbokonenko died heroically, fighting alone against superior enemy forces in the Belgorod region.
original:
Forwarded from: Vasily Orlov
We honor the memory of our Amur Heroes. In honor of DVOKU graduate Pavel Gorbokonenko, a memorial plaque was unveiled today in his home school No. 10 in Blagoveshchensk.
    
The guard major died while covering the detachment, alone waging an unequal battle with superior enemy forces who had penetrated into the territory of the Belgorod region. For courage and heroism, the President awarded Pavel Alexandrovich the title of Hero of Russia.
   
Words of gratitude and low bow to my mother for raising such a son.

event: Russian Use of North Korean Missiles
description: The SBU has confirmed that Russia has used over 20 North Korean Hwasong-11 missiles against Ukraine, resulting in at least 24 civilian deaths and over 100 serious injuries. The strikes targeted Zaporozhye, Kyiv, Donetsk region, and Kharkov.
original:
The SBU has found confirmation that the Russian Federation has already used more than 20 North Korean Hwasong-11 (KN-23/24) missiles against Ukraine.

One of the first strikes was on Zaporozhye on December 30, 2023. Then on a high-rise building in Kyiv, front-line villages in the Donetsk region and Kharkov.

These strikes, the SBU reports, killed at least 24 civilians and more than a hundred civilians were seriously injured.

It was previously reported that North Korea uses Western parts in these missiles, which it receives bypassing sanctions.

Meanwhile, the Russian Federation received hundreds of ballistic missiles from Iran. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

description: Lieutenant Colonel Yaroshenko, a member of the 1st Separate Tank Brigade 'Severskaya', was killed in action. He had a history of photo manipulation, evident in his graduation photos from the Sumy Pedagogical Institute in 2010. Yaroshenko's military career began in 2014 during the ATO, and he eventually rose through the ranks before meeting his demise on February 22.

Operation "Liquidation". Ukro-Lieutenant Colonel - ultra-photoshopper An “interesting” selection of photographs was made for himself in 2010 for graduation from the Sumy Pedagogical Institute by the future lieutenant colonel of the Ukro-band formation called “1st Separate Tank Brigade “Severskaya” Igoreshka Yaroshenko.; 4 of them, with a pasted-in face of this action movie are located on the left.

Of course, Yaroshenko has nothing to do with the background in other people’s photographs. His career growth began in 2014 with the so-called. ATO. He worked his way through the service and even rose to the rank, but on February 22 he ended up on the list of dead Erlys. That’s where he belongs. Vyacheslav Yakovenko (“Kerch”)

description: Emergency Situations Ministry employees responded to a fire in a private house on Zheleznyaka Street in Yenakievo, where a man born in 1966 died. The fire damaged furniture and cladding on an area of 3 square meters. The cause of the fire is being investigated.
original:
Emergency Situations Ministry employees extinguished a fire in a private house in Yenakievo, in which a man died
In the evening, line 101 received a message about a fire in a private house on Zheleznyaka Street in Yenakievo.
Emergency Situations Ministry employees promptly arrived at the scene of the incident.
Show more
We installed burning of things and furniture in the house, as well as cladding on an area of 3 square meters.
Unfortunately, as a result of the fire, a man born in 1966 died; rescuers found him on the floor in the bedroom. The cause of the fire is being established.
From the Ministry of Emergency Situations of Russia in the DPR, 2 units of equipment and 9 personnel were involved.
REMEMBER: everyone can prevent a tragedy! It is enough to follow simple fire safety rules:
Do not leave switched on household electrical appliances unattended.
Be careful when using gas appliances.
Make sure the electrical wiring is in good condition.
Don't smoke in bed.
Your safety is your responsibility!

description: Vityazeva, a patriot for Soloviev Life, initially reacted with joy and moralizing to Murza's suicide, but later deleted the post and wrote something sad. She was awarded the 'For Courage' medal, which is considered a 'soldier's' medal.
original:
Forwarded from: Kartavykh Alexander
And according to Vityazeva, who works as a patriot for Soloviev Life, I can say the following:

1. After Murza’s suicide, she immediately ran to sneer in her cart. Then, apparently, they corrected her, she deleted the post and wrote something sad. But the Internet remembers everything, the deleted post is on the screen. I don’t see anything there except bloodthirsty joy and moralizing.

2. She somehow magically received a medal "For Courage", which is considered a "soldier's" medal. And she went to brag about it. Why she was awarded this particular medal would be very interesting to see.

It’s very surprising to me to see how this native of Odessa savors the death of a Russian soldier, no matter what he was. Everything is mixed up in the domestic media.

But no matter how everything gets mixed up here, it’s wild and disgusting to choke your face when a Russian soldier puts a bullet in his head, unable to bear moral burdens and deprivations. At this moment you need to bow your head and pay tribute. And then you can continue to threaten and make clever jokes in your vile voice.

At this point, of course, your political instincts failed. Your mustache has come unglued) And the Internet will remember this, Vityazeva. Don’t try this again, otherwise you’ll be fired from the Patriots.

description: Murz, a dedicated comrade-in-arms, has passed away. He was a man of principles, a great specialist, and provided significant assistance to the front. His death is a significant loss, and the circumstances surrounding it need to be thoroughly investigated.
original:
Forwarded from: Oleg Tsarev
The whole day I was impressed by the news of Murza’s death. Murz is a caring, convinced comrade-in-arms of ours. Murz did not live - he burned. People like him cause irritation and misunderstanding among those who are in it for money or a career, because he is not for the first or the second. He is for convictions, for truth, for friends.

Today is a holiday in Ukraine. There our enemies rejoice. They write that Murz provided great assistance to the front. And they are right. This is true. A man of principles. Great specialist. If he had been tasked with establishing communications on the entire front, there would definitely have been a front with communications. For enemies it’s a holiday, but for you and me it’s a big loss.

I am sure that the circumstances of his death need to be thoroughly investigated. It is desirable that the investigation materials and results be open to the public. We sincerely thank Deputy Matveev, who is asking for an investigation into the causes of Murza’s death. If he takes the investigation process under his parliamentary control, I am sure he will receive support not only from me, but also from the huge number of Murz’s subscribers, from his friends, from the fighters whom he helped.

Murza's circle of friends and likes is wide. But, unfortunately, no one can replace Murza.

description: Security forces raided a private party in a cottage in Koltushi, Leningrad region, claiming it was an 'LGBT* party against the SVO.' The police found items with LGBT symbols, anti-war leaflets, sex toys, and unknown drugs. The party's organizer, Elena Belokurova, denied any wrongdoing, stating it was a birthday celebration.
original:
Security forces disrupted a private party in the Leningrad region. Propaganda claims that it was an “LGBT* party against the SVO.” The police broke into a private event in a cottage in the town of Koltushi near St. Petersburg. Stories about this were shown on the Ren-TV and 78 TV channels. The video shows about 20 young people lying face down on the floor.

The authors of the reports, citing security forces, claim that “things with symbols of the extremist LGBT movement,” anti-war leaflets, sex toys and unknown drugs were found in the house. At the same time, as noted by OVD-Info**, the recordings of the operational shooting were transferred to television channels in violation of the law.

“78.ru” writes that the party was organized by the head of the Bridges Foundation (formerly the NGO German-Russian Exchange***) Elena Belokurova. “Opposition-oriented” events allegedly take place in her house regularly.

At the same time, Belokurova herself says in the video that she does not understand what accusations are being made against her, and she was not at the event itself. Guests at the party claim that it was the birthday of one of those present.

It is reported that after a search and questioning, the party participants were released. The issue of initiating a criminal case is being decided. *recognized as an extremist movement and prohibited in the Russian Federation
**The Ministry of Justice considers him a “foreign agent”
***recognized by the Russian authorities as an “undesirable organization”

description: Pharmacies across the US experienced outages due to a cyberattack on Change Healthcare, which handles patient orders and payments. The attack forced the shutdown of systems for security reasons, disrupting the dispensing of prescription drugs.
original:
🇺🇸Pharmacies across the US are reporting outages due to cyberattacks Change Healthcare, which handles patient orders and payments across the US, reported an “external threat” on Wednesday morning and shut down systems for security reasons.

It is reported that there have been problems with the dispensing of prescription drugs. No timeline has been announced for restoring the system. There is currently no publicly available report on the nature or origin of the cybersecurity issue

description: The Ukrainian Armed Forces began a chaotic and poorly planned withdrawal from Avdiivka, even before Commander-in-Chief Syrsky's order. Exhausted servicemen, who had been serving for two years without rotation, abandoned their positions without prior approval from the command. The retreat was described as a 'dark and dangerous' operation, with some troops being ordered to take positions that had already been lost or destroyed.
original:
The Ukrainian Armed Forces began to withdraw from Avdiivka even before the order of Commander-in-Chief Syrsky, -WP with reference to the Ukrainian military who participated in the last battles in Avdiivka. The retreat is described as poorly planned and chaotic. The servicemen note that they were exhausted after two years of unrotated service, and fatigue forced them to leave their positions “without prior approval from the command.”

Participants in the battles say that the retreat ordered by Syrsky is assessed as a “dark and dangerous” operation, which is not an “orderly retreat to more advantageous positions”, as stated by the Ukrainian command. One soldier said that some troops were ordered to "take positions that had already been lost or destroyed." For prisoners of war, the WP gives a more modest figure than The New York Times. According to the newspaper, we are talking about dozens, not hundreds, of captured Ukrainian soldiers.

description: Russia plans to liberate Dzerzhinsk, a strategic location near Gorlovka, to clear the Ukrainian Armed Forces' stronghold from Slavyansk to Kramatorsk. This move will also partially resolve the issue of shelling in Gorlovka.

Just as Donetsk had Avdeevka, so Dzerzhinsk, which Kyiv valiantly renamed Toretsk, sits as a thorn near Gorlovka. With the liberation of Dzerzhinsk, the problem of shelling of Gorlovka will also be partially resolved, says Oleg Izmailov, a member of the Union of Writers of Russia, author of several books about Donbass.

He spoke about this in an interview with Ukraine.ru.read in full@exclusive_ukraina_ru

event: Japan and South Korea's Concerns Over Trump's Isolationist Sentiments
description: Recent statements by Donald Trump have sparked concerns in Japan and South Korea about the prospects of relations with the US and the potential for isolationist policies. Both countries are taking steps to hedge against Trump's possible return to power, with Japan adding lobbying firms to its register and South Korea pushing for an agreement on US troop deployment.
original:
🇺🇸🇯🇵🇰🇷Recent statements by Donald Trump that he will not interfere with the invasion of Russia and NATO countries have caused a storm of indignation and concern not only in Europe.

Considering how South Korea and Japan have recently been preparing for the possible arrival of Trump in the White House, local politicians and businessmen are concerned about the prospects for the development of relations with the United States and the isolationist sentiments of the former president.▪️For example, last year the Japanese Embassy in the United States added three lobbying firms to its register, one of which is close to Trump. In addition, former Japanese Prime Minister Taro Asov traveled to the States in January to negotiate with the former president, but failed to get a meeting with him.▪️In South Korea they are also trying to gain “access to the body.” They insist on concluding an agreement on the deployment of the US Armed Forces contingent in the near future - several years ago, Trump asked for exorbitant money from Seoul, which is why the negotiations were painfully slow and caused many conflicts.▪️Fears remain in the area of trade. Seoul and Tokyo understand that South Korean and Japanese goods may be subject to high duties similar to Chinese ones if Trump comes to power. At least the former president will be able to threaten them, as in the past. Trump’s isolationist statements are clearly straining American partners in the Asia-Pacific region. After all, if he becomes president for the second time, then US policy towards South Korea and Japan could become much tougher than under the Democrats. #USA#Japan#SouthKorea@rybartogether with @awaken_dragonSupport usNikkei AsiaJapan steps up lobbying in Washington, hedging for Trump's returnEmbassy retains an army of advisers, but weak currency causes headaches

event: Discovery of Jehovah's Witnesses Extremist Materials
description: The Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR and the National Guard in Mariupol identified a location used by the banned Jehovah's Witnesses organization to promote extremist ideology. Over 5,000 books were confiscated, with half intended for distribution among school-age children. The literature contained propaganda promoting exclusivity and superiority based on social, racial, national, or religious affiliation. Financial reports revealed the organization's involvement in financing Ukrainian armed forces.
original:
Forwarded from: Pushilin D.V.
As a result of joint activities of the Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR and the National Guard in Mariupol, a place was identified that was used by the Jehovah's Witnesses organization banned in Russia to promote extremist ideology.

During the inspection of the building, more than 5 thousand books were discovered and confiscated, approximately half of which were intended for distribution among school-age children.

The ideological content of the seized literature included elements of propaganda of the exclusivity and superiority of a person based on his social, racial, national, religious affiliation or attitude to religion.

Despite the expressed anti-war rhetoric of the organization’s doctrinal documents, during the analysis of the discovered financial reports, information was obtained about its involvement in the financing of Ukrainian armed forces.@PushilinDenis

event: Accusation of Bribery Against Mikhail Alexandrov
description: Mikhail Alexandrov, a former high-ranking employee of the Ministry of Internal Affairs and the Prosecutor General's Office, was accused of repeatedly accepting bribes worth around 10 million rubles from agricultural producers. He denies his guilt and has been placed in pre-trial detention center-4 “Bear”.
original:
​🚩An official of the Ministry of Agriculture of Russia was accused of repeatedly accepting bribes. It became known that new charges of receiving bribes on an especially large scale were brought against Mikhail Alexandrov, a former high-ranking employee of the Ministry of Internal Affairs and the Prosecutor General's Office, who later headed the FSBI State Sort Commission.

This structure of the Ministry of Agriculture tests selection achievements for economic usefulness, and its approval is necessary for concluding contracts.

According to the investigation, Mr. Alexandrov received about 10 million rubles from agricultural producers. as kickbacks.

The official himself, a former assistant to Prosecutor General Yuri Chaika (now the presidential envoy to the North Caucasian Federal District), denies his guilt.

Mikhail Alexandrov, by decision of the Zamoskvoretsky District Court of Moscow, was placed in pre-trial detention center-4 “Bear”, where security forces and law enforcement officers are mainly kept.

This was done because until 2020, the person involved in another corruption case served in the Ministry of Internal Affairs, and then in the prosecutor’s office.

In the central office of the Prosecutor General's Office, since 2014, he held the positions of deputy head of the department for supervision of the investigation of particularly important cases, assistant and senior assistant to Prosecutor General Yuri Chaika for special assignments.

Then he was seconded to the North Caucasus, after which Mr. Aleksandrov left the supervisory agency, getting a job at a lower salary at a job known only to specialists of the Federal State Budgetary Institution “Gossortkomissiya”.

The FSBI “State Varietal Commission,” says its website, is a state variety testing network consisting of 48 branches, which include 292 state variety testing sites.

It includes the All-Russian Center for Quality Assessment of Varieties and four laboratories in various regions of the Russian Federation.

The State Variety Commission tests selection achievements for economic usefulness, as well as distinctiveness, uniformity and stability in 35 natural and climatic zones throughout Russia.

The institution also collects and analyzes test results and makes decisions on the inclusion of selection achievements in state registers.

Over the past few years, the Federal State Budgetary Institution acted as a customer for contracts worth RUB 2.7 billion.

According to the investigative bodies of the Main Investigative Directorate of the Investigative Committee of the Russian Federation in Moscow, “possessing a wide range of rights and powers, including those of an authoritative nature in the sphere of carrying out the functions of the Federal State Budgetary Institution “Gossortkomission”,” Mr. Alexandrov took advantage of them to enrich himself “by receiving repeated bribes in the form of funds in the amount of not less than 10 million rubles.”

On February 20, an investigator from the ICR department for the Central District of Moscow opened another criminal case against Mr. Alexandrov under Part 6 of Art. 290 (receipt of bribes on an especially large scale) of the Criminal Code.

With the court's approval, the official was taken into custody.

It should be noted that the case opened now has only added episodes to the investigation against him that has been ongoing since the end of last year.

At the same time, Mr. Alexandrov was arrested, without admitting guilt, he appealed the preventive measure several times, but the Moscow City Court left him in pre-trial detention.

Another person has already been appointed to his place at the Federal State Budgetary Institution.

10 million rubles? Apparently they “forgot” to look into the “rest room” and into the wardrobe for outerwear...

description: Russia is set to launch the largest LNG project in the Arctic, despite US sanctions. original:

China helped👏The Financial Times reports that the first batch of gas from the Arctic LNG-2 project should be shipped soon. Chinese specialists helped put the first line of the plant into operation; they solved the logistics and technical problems that arose after the Western partners left the project. The Chinese also helped develop technological solutions for launching the second line.

The United States imposed strict sanctions against Arctic LNG 2 in November last year, in particular, foreign partners of the project were prohibited from purchasing raw materials there. This was the first time that sanctions affected not pipeline gas, but LNG. In fact, the Americans are trying to remove an unnecessary competitor in this way. After all, after the Europeans abandoned Russian gas, they began to purchase LNG from the United States at very high prices.

Forwarded from: RT in Russian
❗️Exclusive

A traitor is a traitor, he will be removed sooner or later anyway.” RT talked with the father of the murdered Spanish pilot-traitor Kuzminov. The man believes that Kuzminov’s mother was “recruited by someone” abroad, where she lived, about 15 years ago: “It seems to me that in any case, the mother played some role [in her son’s betrayal].”

event: Career Guidance Services for Young People
description: DPR employment centers provided nearly 1,500 career guidance services to young people since the beginning of the year. The services aim to introduce schoolchildren to in-demand professions, teach them to identify and choose a future profession, and provide training seminars for graduates on competent employment.
original:
Since the beginning of the year, DPR employment centers have provided nearly one and a half thousand career guidance services to young people, said Deputy Chairman of the DPR Government Larisa Tolstykina.

“Schoolchildren are introduced to in-demand professions, taught to correctly identify and consciously choose a future profession, taking into account the needs of the labor market.

Graduates of colleges, technical schools and universities participate in training seminars that teach competent employment: searching for information about vacancies, writing a resume, organizing a successful interview with an employer.

Career guidance specialists also have professional tours for young people to leading enterprises, quest games and quizzes, and career days,” the Deputy Prime Minister noted, adding that the employment service database contains more than 25 thousand job offers.

event: Cocoa Beans Become Most Expensive Commodity
description: Cocoa beans have become the most expensive commodity in the world, with a 50% price increase since the beginning of the year and a 130% rise since 2022. The El Niño climate phenomenon, leading to drought in West Africa, is the main reason for the price surge. The region's old and vulnerable trees, lack of investment, and consumption outpacing harvests have contributed to the crisis.
original:
👉The most expensive commodity in the world has been named🍫Cocoa beans have become the most expensive commodity in the world. Since the beginning of the year, the cost of cocoa has increased by more than 50%, to a record level since the 1970s. Since 2022, cocoa beans have risen in price by 130%. The reason for the rise in price was called the El Niño climate phenomenon, which led to drought in West Africa.

It is noted that most of the trees in West Africa are already old and vulnerable to weather conditions and diseases, and there has been no investment in the industry. For three years now, consumption has outpaced harvests, writes newspaper.a42.ru.

Prices may soon rise by another 30%, experts warn.t.me/aifmd

description: A 44-year-old man in Moscow fell victim to a sophisticated scam, losing 17.6 million rubles. Criminals posing as Investigative Committee and Central Bank employees convinced him that his account held stolen funds belonging to the Central Bank. They promised to return the stolen amount if he transferred 10.6 million rubles to the Central Bank, and later convinced him to take out loans and transfer more funds to their account.
original:
In Moscow, a 44-year-old man transferred 17.6 million rubles to criminals due to reports that the funds in his account belonged to the Central Bank and needed to be returned. They screwed him, of course, professionally: the scammers contacted the man via messenger and introduced themselves as employees of the Investigative Committee and the Central Bank. The attackers said that funds in the amount of 10.6 million rubles from his bank accounts were stolen by unknown persons, and those in the man’s account did not belong to him, but to the Central Bank.

The criminals promised to return the stolen funds, since the unknown persons who allegedly took his funds had already been caught. However, to do this, the man must first transfer 10.6 million rubles from his account with the Central Bank. Our hero began to act. First, he transferred the “found” 10.6 million rubles back to the Central Bank.

But the villains did not stop and suddenly found out that they wanted to steal his money again. The caller convinced the Muscovite to apply for bank loans in the amount of 7 million rubles and transfer funds from ATMs in different parts of the city to the specified account. The total amount of damage amounted to 17.6 million rubles.

The leader of the mammoths has been found.

event: Meeting of the Expert Council on Industrial Infrastructure Development
description: The State Duma Committee on Industry and Trade will host a meeting of the Expert Council to discuss industrial infrastructure development, including industrial clusters, state support measures, and sustainable development of infrastructure facilities.
original: On March 13, the State Duma will host a general meeting of members of the Association of Clusters, Technology Parks and Special Economic Zones of Russia. Within the framework of it, a meeting of the Expert Council on the development of industrial infrastructure (industrial parks, technology parks, eco-technoparks and clusters) of the State Duma Committee of the Russian Federation on Industry and Trade will be held. The first topic is industrial clusters and support measures. Changes in the operating mode of clusters from 2023, as well as proposals for their improvement, will be discussed. Participants of the meeting will study the experience of industrial clusters in the Kemerovo region and the methodology of working with industrial clusters in the Omsk region. The second block of the meeting is devoted to measures of state support for industrial infrastructure, including an assessment of the application of the Government of the Russian Federation No. 1325 and the problem of co-financing for technology parks in the field of high technologies. The third issue of the meeting is sustainable development of industrial infrastructure facilities, with the presentation of the main provisions of the Standard “Sustainable development of management companies of infrastructure sites. General requirements".

description: The Rodina Charitable Foundation, led by Dmitry Nazarov, has united active citizens, volunteers, and military personnel in the Amur region to support those fighting in the West. The foundation comprises individuals from various professions, including military personnel, entrepreneurs, doctors, and teachers.
original:
Forwarded from: ROKOT AMUR 28🇷🇺
We follow the successes of our comrades and recently came across a publication in the portal of the APKAmur region about the activities of the Rodina Charitable Foundation. We often write about it in connection with the fact that together we help our cadets and instructors located in the Northern Military District zone.

There was complete mutual understanding with the director of the Foundation, Dmitry Nazarov, and his comrades; the guys were reserve military personnel, many took part in hostilities, and in peacetime they chose the occupation that real warriors had chosen centuries before them - they became cultivators.

The history of our region is such that in wartime Amur residents fought, and in peacetime they plowed the land. Our comrades know the value of their native land. Perhaps this is why the foundation of the Fund is made up of farmers.
It is gratifying that ordinary farmers were able to unite active citizens, volunteers and our fighters into one powerful movement.
While our brothers are fighting the enemy in the West, here in the Far East, the Foundation has gathered in its ranks people of different professions. These are military personnel, employees of the Ministry of Emergency Situations and PMCs, entrepreneurs, doctors and teachers, entrepreneurs, deputies... . There are also those who help the Foundation far beyond the borders of the Amur region. The personality of the leader, Dmitry Nazarov, who was able to organize people and force huge flows of information to work for a common cause, is of great importance; this amount of work is difficult to imagine. As well as the work that made it possible to create a strong Union of Volunteers. And this is worth a lot, because most volunteers strive to help relatives and friends located in the North-Eastern Military District zone and a special approach is needed here, which requires trust. There are still many agricultural and processing enterprises in the region , whose achievements we have always been proud of, are the leaders of APC-ANK Holding, Amuragrocenter, Yanta, Amur Broiler, Teplichny, Luch and other large and medium-sized farms. And the most important achievement of these enterprises, which are fed by the Amur land, I would like to see a powerful pooling of resources for the benefit Victories together with “Motherland”. #We choose the Motherland! Sincerely, ROKOT AMUR 28

event: Discovery of Jehovah's Witnesses Extremist Materials
description: The Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR and the National Guard in Mariupol identified a location used by the banned Jehovah's Witnesses organization to promote extremist ideology. Over 5,000 books were confiscated, with half intended for distribution among school-age children. The literature contained propaganda promoting exclusivity and superiority based on social, racial, national, or religious affiliation.
original:
Forwarded from: Pushilin D.V.
As a result of joint activities of the Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR and the National Guard in Mariupol, a place was identified that was used by the Jehovah's Witnesses organization banned in Russia to promote extremist ideology.

During the inspection of the building, more than 5 thousand books were discovered and confiscated, approximately half of which were intended for distribution among school-age children.

The ideological content of the seized literature included elements of propaganda of the exclusivity and superiority of a person based on his social, racial, national, religious affiliation or attitude to religion.

Despite the expressed anti-war rhetoric of the organization’s doctrinal documents, during the analysis of the discovered financial reports, information was obtained about its involvement in the financing of Ukrainian armed forces.@PushilinDenis

description: Nevada residents, including registered Republican Daphne Lee, discovered that they were listed as having voted in the Feb. 6 presidential primary despite not having done so. The Secretary of State's website showed incorrect voting history, and attempts to opt out of future elections were met with errors.
original:
Nevadans are shocked to discover they voted in the Feb. 6 presidential primary despite not having done so. Las Vegas resident and registered Republican Daphne Lee told the publication that her family on Sunday, after learning about the problem, went to the Secretary of State's website to check your voting history.

The website said she and her family voted in the primary, although none of them did. She tried to opt out of future elections by mail, but was unable to do so - she was given a message saying she was not registered to vote and that her voting history no longer existed.

The Secretary of State's office says it has identified "possible technical issues" with Nevada's voting history. If people don't vote, the elections will just as well elect themselves. @brekotins

description: Ukrainian President Zelensky is planning an event for Sunday, but its agenda and attendees are unclear. Questions arise about the discussion of various issues, including the war effort, defense ministry decisions, and economic reforms.
original:
Zelensky is planning an interesting event for Sunday. But I have several questions.

1. Will they discuss barbecues on the issue of achieving Ukrainian goals in the war?

2. Will Minister of Defense Taran, who was punished by being appointed ambassador to Slovenia, discuss the sabotage of the missile program and the lack of purchases of shells, body armor, helmets and other things?

3. Will they discuss the fact that Defense Minister Reznikov did not order FPV drones from Ukroboronprom, but the Ministry of Defense planned to purchase eggs for 17 hryvnias as part of the work of the Ukrainian defense-industrial complex?

4. Will Tatarov's sabotage of the BEB reform and Mazepa's arrest be discussed as a means of ensuring Ukraine's economic growth and integration into world markets?

I still have many questions. From whether there will be representatives of the opposition media at this forum and whether Lieutenant Bakanov will report there, to whether Zelensky wants to apologize for ignoring warnings about the invasion and refusing to carry out early evacuation and mobilization?

So will all this be?

description: The authorities of Riga have decided to rename streets with Russian names, including Moskovskaya Street, which has borne its name for 170 years. The decision aims to send a different signal to the local population and international community.
original:
The authorities of Riga will rename the “Russian” streets of the city and remove Moskovskaya Street from the map. “Moskovskaya Street is one of the central streets of Riga, and its name sends the wrong signal to the local population and to the international community,” said the city’s vice-mayor Edward Ratnieks. This will affect streets that are named after Russian writers and scientists: Pushkin, Turgenev, Gogol, Lermontov, Lomonosov.

It is noteworthy that Moskovskaya Street bore this name for about 170 years, while the new, as Ratnieks believes, “historical” name Latgales, lasted only two years - from 1938 to 1940. Uncle Slava. Subscribe.

event: Discrimination Against Soldier in Nizhny Novgorod
description: A soldier on leave from a special military operation zone was denied entry to local clubs in Nizhny Novgorod due to wearing military uniform. Honored Lawyer of Russia Ivan Solovyov considers this a case of discrimination and advocates for holding establishments accountable.
location: Nizhny Novgorod, Nizhny Novgorod Oblast, Russia
original:
There are no laws in Russia that would allow restaurants, clubs and other establishments not to admit people in military uniform, Honored Lawyer of Russia Ivan Solovyov told the newspaper VZGLYAD.

He believes that cases where people were refused service because they were wearing military uniform should be regarded as discrimination and such establishments should be held accountable.

In Nizhny Novgorod, a soldier who came on leave from a special military operation (SVO) zone was not allowed into local clubs, Gazeta.ru reports. Ru". In one of the institutions they “referred to the order of the administration,” in another they explained the refusal by the appearance of the fighter - he was dressed in military uniform.

“The situation is wild. In general, wearing military uniform in public places, including restaurants and clubs, cannot be prohibited. Moreover, the question of banning the wearing of military uniforms in public places should not even be raised,” Solovyov emphasized.

According to him, the incident with the SVO fighter in the club can also be considered as a manifestation of discrimination, including on the basis of gender, race, belonging to a certain social group and can be prosecuted under Article 282 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (inciting hatred or enmity, as well as humiliation of humanity dignity).

“This is due to the fact that one part of our society is at war, and the other is resting and trying to pretend that nothing is happening at all. Therefore, this very part of society, which is embarrassed by our fighters, needs to be brought to its senses, including by holding accountable those institutions where discriminatory measures are applied to our fighters,” the interlocutor emphasized. Subscribe to VZGLYAD

event: Court Declares 'I/We Sergei Furgal' Movement Extremist
description: A court in Khabarovsk declared the 'I/We Sergei Furgal' movement extremist, citing its alleged incitement of hatred and hostility towards government institutions and attempts to change power in Russia by force.
original:
❗️The court in Khabarovsk declared the “movement “I/We Sergei Furgal” extremist.” The prosecutor’s office filed such a claim in court. The department stated that the movement of supporters of the former governor of the Khabarovsk Territory Sergei Furgal “under the guise of ideas of protecting and supporting the former governor of the region carries out extremist activities.” “The unifying basis of the movement is an extremist ideology, which consists in inciting hatred and hostility towards representatives of government institutions, destroying legal foundations and the values of society,” the prosecutor’s office said. The department believes that the “I/We Sergei Furgal movement” seeks to change power in the Russian Federation by force.

———

Sergei Furgal was the governor of the Khabarovsk Territory in 2018-2020. He was detained in July 2020, accused of involvement in contract killings. After this, mass protests began in Khabarovsk. Sergei Furgal was sentenced to 22 years in a maximum security colony in February 2023.

How supporters of Sergei Furgal can protect themselves in connection with the court decision in the case of extremism can be read in Meduza’s material, which was released on February 7 (the text will open without a VPN at this link). Meduza Russian authorities have discovered new “extremists” - these are supporters of Sergei FurgalMovement “I” /We are Sergei Furgal” could be declared extremist and banned in Russia. The corresponding claim of the prosecutor of the Khabarovsk Territory will be considered on February 22...

event: Meeting of Expert Council on Legislative Activities
description: The Expert Council on Legislative Activities of United Russia, led by Tatyana Butskaya, met with representatives from Roskachestvo, the Ministry of Education, and experts to discuss issues related to the development of a standard for the classification of games, toys, and play structures.
original:
Today, at a meeting of the group for analyzing projects in the field of protection of family, motherhood and childhood of the Expert Council on Legislative Activities of United Russia, under the leadership of the First Deputy Chairman of the State Duma Committee on Family Protection, Issues of Paternity, Maternity and Childhood Tatyana Butskaya, together with representatives of Roskachestvo, The Ministry of Education and experts discussed issues
Show more
development of a standard (GOST) for the classification of games, toys and play structures.
In her speech, as one of the authors of laws banning the promotion of non-traditional values and the activities of foreign agents, she noted that we do not pay enough attention to children's toys. There is a ban on educational activities for foreign agents, but nothing about education in kindergartens. The kindergarten, in principle, fell out of the system. I hope our work will bridge this gap.
They also discussed the importance of transparency in the chain of production and distribution of goods, the problem of examination of toys, financing and end customers of products, as well as the need to resolve issues related to specialists in psychological and pedagogical examination.
It is worth noting the need to refine GOST and send it to various departments, including the Public Chamber of the Russian Federation. The issues of conducting an examination of toys and determining criteria for experts will still be discussed. It is important that not all toys will be evaluated by experts, but only those that have already raised doubts.
The draft standard has already been prepared and will be voluntary, but mandatory for public procurement.
