event: Croatian Citizens' Perception of NATO Membership
description: A Croatian Radio-TV survey revealed that over 50% of Croatian citizens do not believe that NATO membership is a sufficient guarantee of national security in the event of a security threat and military crisis. Instead, they advocate for strengthening their own defense capabilities, with varying opinions on how to achieve this.
original:
🇭🇷Croats do not trust NATO▪️According to a Croatian Radio-TV survey, more than 50% of Croatian citizens believe that the country's NATO membership is not a sufficient guarantee of national security in the event of a security threat and military crisis.▪️56.8% of respondents said that Croatia it is necessary to further strengthen our own defense capabilities, and 32% of them believe that membership in the Alliance is a sufficient guarantee, and 11% have no opinion on this matter.▪️The survey showed that 74.4% of citizens now consider the state of security in the world to be significant or partly worse than last year.▪️In this survey, Croats also had the opportunity to express their opinion on what they see as a solution to increasing defense capability: 25.5% of respondents believe that this is compulsory military training for all men, and voluntary for women, and 20.3% believe that the solution is to increase the professional composition of the Croatian army.▪️The results also showed that 15.4% of Croats hope that the country will become safer if the ground army is strengthened with new equipment and formations, and 13.7% of They believe that the key to success lies in strengthening the air force and air defense systems.

How so? NATO will definitely intervene in any conflict and protect Croatia! Or not? @vestniksrb—the main thing about Serbia and the Balkans

description: Footballer Dani Alves was sentenced to four and a half years in prison for raping a 23-year-old woman in a Barcelona nightclub. The court found that the victim did not consent to sex, and the rape was confirmed by her testimony and other evidence.
original:
Footballer Dani Alves was sentenced to four and a half years in prison for rape. The court in Barcelona considered it proven that the 23-year-old victim did not consent to sex, and the fact of rape, in addition to her testimony, was confirmed by other evidence. According to the court's decision, Alves must also pay the victim 150 thousand euros.

Alves initially denied the allegations, but then said it was all consensual. The prosecutor sought that the football player be given nine years in prison.

The football player was arrested in January 2023. The victim stated that in December 2022, the football player molested her in the VIP area in one of the nightclubs in Barcelona. She added that Alves took her into the bathroom, where he forced her to give him a blow job, hit her and raped her.

The footballer's wife Joana Sanz filed for divorce.

———

40-year-old Dani Alves is one of the most famous Brazilian footballers of the last decade. He spent most of his career playing for Barcelona. Alves also played for Sevilla, Juventus and PSG. In 2022-2023, Alves played for UNAM Pumas from Mexico, but after the arrest of the football player, the club terminated his contract.

description: A leaked letter from the University Hospital of Sussex's head sparked controversy over the use of drugs to stimulate lactation in transgender mothers. The doctor argued that the milk is comparable to that of biological mothers, but critics, including Labor MP Rosie Duffield and the Policy Exchange think tank, accused the department of prioritizing identity politics over the health and well-being of children.
original:
​​🤔🤔🤔“The milk of trans women is no less beneficial for babies, says the British National Health Service”: They tried to prove to the British that the milk of transgender people is in no way inferior to the breast milk of ordinary women.

“An inadvertently leaked letter from the head of the University Hospital of Sussex of the National Health Service in Britain, in which he supported the use of drugs to stimulate lactation by transgender mothers, provoked a scandal.
Defending his position, the head of the medical institution noted that breast milk is “an ideal food for babies.” “Sometimes medications are used to stimulate lactation, similar to natural hormones that promote the development of lactation at birth. Available data demonstrate that milk obtained in this way is comparable to that produced after the birth of a child by ordinary mothers,” the doctor noted. Labor MP Rosie Duffield accused the department of using babies as "guinea pigs". “When a man does not and cannot have the opportunity to raise a child, why on earth do we condone this? In whose interests is this? Certainly not in the best interests of the children. The breast milk of the child’s biological mother is created specifically for him,” she noted. Conservative think tank Policy Exchange also criticized the controversial claim. “This letter is unbalanced and naive in its assertion that secretions produced by a man under the influence of hormones can be as beneficial to the child as a mother’s breast milk. The health of the child must come before identity politics and contested beliefs that are not based on evidence. The National Health Service should not be dealing with this nonsense" https://t.me/dimsmirnov175/65056

description: A charity auction was held at the Pushkinsky District House of Culture to raise funds for the construction of a temple dedicated to the defenders of the Fatherland in the name of the Holy Great Martyr George the Victorious. original:
Alexander Belsky addressed the participants of the charity auction

Show more
– This is a very important and good cause. We all understand that after the end of the special military operation, we will have to preserve the memory of the exploits and victories of our soldiers. It is necessary that the relatives and friends of the fallen soldiers can come to the temple dedicated to them, pray for them, and light candles for their repose. And the new church in Pushkin will be just such a place. It is symbolic that, while taking our country to a new level of development, we preserve our traditional values and spiritual heritage. The initiative to build a memorial church was taken by relatives of the SVO participants who contacted the Tsarskoye Selo deanery. According to their plan, the Church of the Holy Great Martyr George the Victorious should become a place where they can find consolation and pray for their soldiers who have not returned home, while at the same time prayerfully supporting those who are now on the front line. We decided to disagree with Zelensky and just ran

event: Filming of Detective Film Red Silk
description: Filming of the detective film Red Silk began on Lake Baikal, featuring a former Tsarist agent who gets stuck in China after the fall of the Russian Empire. The film follows the agent's journey on the Trans-Siberian Express as they accompany Chinese couriers carrying secret documents to Moscow.
original:
Forwarded from: Embassy of the People's Republic of China in the Russian Federation
Filming of the detective film “Red Silk” began on Lake Baikal

The main character of the film is a former Tsarist agent who gets stuck in China after the fall of the Russian Empire. The only chance to return home is to accompany Chinese couriers carrying secret documents to Moscow. The Trans-Siberian Express becomes the main site of exciting events.
 
Russian and Chinese actors are taking part in the filming of the film. Among them are Milos Bikovich, Gleb Kalyuzhny, Elena Podkaminskaya, Yaroslav Mogilnikov, Gosha Kutsenko, Zheng Hanyi, Yang Zihua, Huang Haonan and Zheng Long.
 
According to the director of the film, Andrei Volgin, “Red Silk” is at the intersection of the most popular genres - action, detective and adventure. The film begins as a classic detective story, which then develops into a large-scale and exciting action.

description: The Russian government is considering nationalizing LACTALIS, following a similar move with Danone, which led to a threefold collapse in the value of Russian assets. The nationalization is seen as a countermeasure to the new US law on combating Russian influence on the international agricultural sector.
original:
LACTALIS will be nationalized as Danone and sold at a discount
 
The state is increasingly resorting to nationalization of strategically important assets, as, for example, happened with the Ulyanovsk machine tool plant of the Japanese-German DMG Mori or with the French Danone. Moreover, in the case of the latter, nationalization led to a threefold collapse in the value of Russian assets, writes the Financial Times. A similar fate awaits Lactalis.
 
Deputy head of the LDPR faction in the State Duma Alexey Didenko, in a commentary to INFOX.RU, has already suggested that the government consider the possibility of transferring the assets of the concern in the Russian Federation and other foreign companies in the food sector under the management of the Federal Property Management Agency as a counteraction to the new law in the United States on combating Russian influence on the international agricultural sector. And State Duma Deputy Speaker Boris Chernyshov sees a threat in the fact that a foreign company can influence the food market within Russia, writes News.ru.

description: The latest issue of Sobesednik newspaper, featuring Alexei Navalny on the cover, was withdrawn from Moscow distribution points. The publication's journalist, Elena Milchanovska, reported that around 300,000 rubles worth of circulation was seized, and the editorial office is now selling the remaining copies by advance reservation.
original:
The editors of the Sobesednik newspaper stated that the circulation of the latest issue about the death of Alexei Navalny was withdrawn from Moscow distribution points.

The new issue of the weekly “Sobesednik” dated February 20 was published with a portrait of politician Alexei Navalny, who died in a Yamalo-Nenets Autonomous Okrug colony, and the quote “But there is hope!” on the cover. On the double-page spreads there is an obituary, comments by Dmitry Muratov*, Andrei Makarevich*, Oleg Orlov* about the death, his letter and excerpts from an interview, a report from the laying of flowers.

One of the publication’s journalists, Elena Milchanovska, told Beware Media that the issue’s circulation “everywhere or almost everywhere” was seized from Moscow distribution points - mainly the “Press” and “Print” tents: “All this is very serious and even a little scary for us . We don’t know why the number was confiscated: we didn’t break any laws. According to rough estimates, we lost about 300 thousand rubles on the seized circulation. We will no longer be able to return this money. Over the past two years, we have lost many sources of income. We have virtually no print advertising. Roskomnadzor consistently blocked all our sites, today (February 21) another one was blocked, already the fifth in a row, where we had posted all the materials about Navalny from the newspaper the day before. According to Milchanovskaya, the editorial office now has about a hundred copies of the issue with Navalny on the cover, it is sold by advance reservation at one hundred rubles for cash strictly through the cash register with the issuance of a check. – There were a lot of other bad things today associated with this number. For example, calls on editorial phones with insults and threats specifically addressed to me from readers to whom this I didn't like the number. Scary, sad, difficult...*Recognized as a foreign agent by the Ministry of Justice of the Russian Federation https://t.me/+TwWu0hyEb50bn-IL

description: The State Bureau of Investigation of Ukraine uncovered a large-scale corruption network involving TCC employees in Kiev. The scheme, organized by a former head of the Kyiv regional military registration and enlistment office, allowed conscripts to evade mobilization in exchange for bribes of $6-10 thousand and advice on crossing the border.
original:
In Kiev, a corruption network of TCC employees was uncovered. The State Bureau of Investigation of Ukraine completed an investigation into an “unprecedentedly large-scale” scheme for evading mobilization in the territorial recruitment centers of Kyiv and the region, which was uncovered at the end of 2023. The Ukrainian publication reports this.

According to the SBI, the scheme was organized by the former head of the Kyiv regional military registration and enlistment office, who retired but retained connections. Detectives found that conscripts were written off for health reasons in exchange for bribes of $6-10 thousand and given advice on how to cross the border.

The specific number of conscripts who evaded mobilization in this way is not disclosed.

event: Release of Song 'We Will Be Back'
description: Sergey Bobunets and Alexey Poddubny released a video for the song 'We Will Be Back', a manifesto for fighters and those who care. The song is dedicated to those fighting for the future of Russia, inspired by poems from 1941 and 2023.
original:
Forwarded from: Lomovka
Support, faith and love - all that warms our guys who are in the Northern Military District zone. Each of them knows that his family and friends are waiting for him at home.

Sergey Bobunets and Alexey Poddubny (Django) released a video for the song “We will be back,” which will become a manifesto for all fighters and those who care. Watch the video in high resolution: The video captures the real chronicle of the Northern Military District and people - mothers, children and wives who so strongly waiting for their defenders to go home. A seemingly simple poster on an ordinary sheet of paper warms the souls of the soldiers who today stand guard over our Motherland. With this song I wanted to support all those who today are fighting for the bright future of our Motherland. I believe in the safe return home of everyone who had to take up arms in the name of relatives, friends and future generations,” said Sergei Bobunets.

Sergei Bobunts was inspired to write the song by Konstantin Simonov’s poem “Wait for me, and I will return” from 1941 and Dmitry Filippov’s poem “Night Conversation” dedicated to our soldiers during a special operation in 2023, as well as friendship with those mobilized from the 297th Guards Anti-Aircraft Missile Brigade .We will definitely return - there is such a line in this song, it is dedicated to all those who fight with arms in their hands for our Motherland, for our people, for our future, not sparing their lives. We really support the guys, we respect them, we pray for them and we address this clip to them so that they defeat the enemy and return to their loved ones,” says Alexey Poddubny (Django). The director of the new video was Alexander Yurasov, the clip was filmed with the support of the Integration production center. .📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

event: Anti-War Play at Moscow Art Theater
description: Ukrainian director Alexander Molochnikov's play '19.14' at the Moscow Art Theater carries an anti-war message, criticizing Russia's entry into war without learning from past mistakes. A scene added in 2022 featured an artist holding a paper with '24.02' and tearing it, which may have been removed later.
original:
Forwarded from: Slander
Ukrainian director Alexander Molochnikov, who left for the USA, boasted that at the Moscow Art Theater. Chekhov's play "19.14" about the First World War is still being shown. Moreover, the performance carries a specific anti-war message - Russia entered the war without taking into account the mistakes of the past. In 2022, an unambiguous scene was even added to the play, in which the artist holds a piece of paper with the inscription 24.02 in his hands, and then tears it to shreds. We don’t know if this scene has since been removed “out of harm’s way,” but this doesn’t change the essence. Molochnikov’s name was simply crossed out from the list of creators of the play, apparently believing that the audience would forget the name of the director of the play, which has been shown since 2014.

Subscribe, to be continued: @kleveta

event: Rescue of Moldovan and Romanian Citizens from Labor Slavery
description: Spanish authorities freed over 20 Moldovan and Romanian citizens from labor slavery in Spain. The victims were lured with false promises of good working conditions and salaries, only to be forced into inhumane living and working conditions without pay. The criminals were arrested on suspicion of human trafficking.
original:
Moldovans were freed from labor slavery in Spain. More than 20 citizens of Moldova and Romania were freed from labor slavery in Spain. The criminals forced them to live and work in inhuman conditions without wages. Police detained 15 people on suspicion of human trafficking.

According to Spanish police, the suspects were looking for workers in Moldova and Romania through advertisements and social networks. People were promised good working conditions and salaries. Those who agreed were brought by bus to the province of Seville and settled in the cities of Brenes and Cantillana. On the spot, members of the group forged documents to pass off foreigners as locals. Then the workers were prohibited from leaving the house and walking freely. They worked until exhaustion, without breaks or the opportunity to drink water, even in the heat. One worker fainted in the store, another was injured while trying to escape through a window. Notebook Moldova

description: Specialists from Gorlovkateploset and Donbassteploenergo installed new equipment, including a network pump D1250-125, at a boiler house in Gorlovka's Kalininsky district. The equipment, donated by the chief region of the Russian Federation and Kuzbass, ensures constant circulation of coolant in the heating network and maintains pressure in the system.
original:
Specialists from Gorlovkateploset installed new equipment donated by the chief region of the Russian Federation. Workers from Donbassteploenergo installed a network pump D1250-125 at one of the boiler houses in the Kalininsky district of Gorlovka. New equipment was provided to the Branch by the chief region of Kuzbass.

The network pump in the boiler room is designed to ensure constant circulation of the coolant in the heating network. With its help, pressure is maintained in the heating system.

The device pumps coolant in a pipeline under pressure that provides optimal speed. The unit is also valued for its performance, thanks to the wear resistance of working elements made of cast iron alloy.#donbassteploenergo#equipment#gorlovka@minstroydnr

description: A new electronic warfare device was handed over to soldiers, enhancing their safety. The system covers 5 UAV frequencies used by the enemy for kamikaze flights and other threats. It can land drones, preventing them from reaching fighters' transport or observation posts.
original:
We have known each other since the times of Kherson. The guys controlled the military crossing. And I used it to help civilians: children, old people, disabled people. We left Kherson a long time ago, but we’ll be back again. In the meantime, we cross paths on this shore... This time, another cool electronic warfare device was handed over to the soldiers!

The electronic warfare system with additional modules covers 5 UAV frequencies, which the enemy uses for kamikaze flights, drops and other unpleasant surprises for the guys. And now our guys are much safer from all this, because the reb lands the drones, not allowing them to get closer to the fighters’ transport or observation post.

Thanks to the trade union of the Federal State Unitary Enterprise “All-Russian Research Institute of Automation named after N. L. Dukhov and the employees of the entire enterprise for the funds for the purchase of equipment!

Thanks to the Hostesses of Simferopol, News from Crimea, Marina from Sevastopol for the treats. description: KNDISE is investigating the wreckage of a Kh-69 missile, a new type of air-launched missile used by the Russians in Ukraine. The missile, a modification of the Kh-59MK2, is launched from fighters and bombers and has a range of approximately 290 km with a 310 kg warhead.

The Russians are using new Kh-69 missiles in Ukraine. The wreckage of one of these missiles is being investigated by KNDISE. The Kh-69 air-launched missile is the result of a modification of the Kh-59MK2, it is launched from fighters and bombers.

The enemy began to actively use this type of missile on the territory of Ukraine in 2023.

The hull of the Kh-69 rocket has a square cross-section.

According to Russian data, the range of the "X-69" is about 290 km, the weight of the warhead is 310 kg. The rocket belongs to the inconspicuous ones.

event: Delivery of Modernized BMP-1AM Infantry Fighting Vehicles
description: A batch of modernized BMP-1AM 'Basurmanin' infantry fighting vehicles was sent to the special operation zone. The vehicles underwent complete repairs or replacement of major components and assemblies. They are equipped with a unified fighting compartment, 30-mm automatic cannon, machine gun, fire control system, and anti-tank guided weapons.
original:
A batch of modernized BMP-1AM "Basurmanin" infantry fighting vehicles went to the special operation zone. The next batch of modernized BMP-1AM "Basurmanin" infantry fighting vehicles went to the troops by rail, how many vehicles in the batch was not disclosed. It is noted that during the work carried out, all major components and assemblies were completely repaired or replaced with new ones. Most of these infantry fighting vehicles will appear in the North-East Military District zone in the near future.

During the modernization of the BMP-1 to the BMP-1AM "Basurmanin" version, the vehicle receives a unified fighting compartment from the BTR-82A with a 30-mm 2A72 automatic cannon and a 7.62-mm PKTM machine gun.

The BMP is equipped with a fire control system with a combined all-day anti-aircraft sight TKN-4GA-01, a two-plane weapon stabilizer and anti-tank guided weapons ATGM 9K115 "Metis". In addition, the new BMP is equipped with a UTD-20S1 engine and torsion shafts with increased energy intensity.

"Diary of a Trooper"

description: Three attacks targeted concentrations of Russian military personnel in open areas, specifically a training ground in the Aleshkinsky Sands National Park, 10-15 km from Krynki. The strikes, likely carried out using HIMARS MLRS and short-range drones, utilized M30A1 GMLRS with tungsten balls. The attacks highlight the continued mistake of mass gatherings of personnel in open spaces.
location: Aleshkinsky Sands National Park, Kherson Oblast, Ukraine
original:
A day and a half after the tragedy near Volnovakha, three more attacks occurred on concentrations of Russian military personnel in open areas.
This time we are talking about a training ground in the Aleshkinsky Sands National Park, located 10-15 km from the ill-fated Krynki.
Show more
Strike 1: 46.54426.., 33.10098..
Strike 2: 46.54359.., 33.09835..
Strike 3: 46.54400.., 33.10113..
Moreover, the third blow was dealt, apparently, to the investigative and operational group that carried out the relevant activities.
The opposite bank of the Dnieper and Tyaginka from the center of the park is about 20 km. Operating distance for HIMARS MLRS and short range drones. The strikes were made by M30A1 GMLRS with tungsten balls inside.
On February 21, it was sunny in the Kherson region, the air warmed up to 13 degrees (the footage, alas, is not summer). The time of impact was around 14:00 (we do not rule out that the personnel could have gathered to move out for a meal).
Regardless of what happens in the coastal strip and on the islands, it is obvious from the example of this strike that the mistake of mass gatherings of personnel in open space has been and continues to be made.
The second year of the SVO was ending.
#Russia #Ukraine #Kherson

event: Anti-Turkish Uprising in Moldova and Greece
description: Alexander Ypsilanti led an anti-Turkish uprising in Moldova and Greece, calling on the population to rebel against the Turkish rule. This marked the beginning of the Greek revolution of 1821-1829.
original:
Calendar: February 22, Alexander Ypsilanti raised an anti-Turkish uprising in Moldova and Greece. February 22, 1821, Alexander Konstantinovich Ypsilanti, taking advantage of the death of the ruler of Wallachia and Moldova, Alexander Sutsu, crossed the Prut with a group of supporters.

Having entered the territory of the Moldavian principality, he called on its population to rebel against the Turkish yoke. This marked the beginning of the Greek revolution of 1821-1829.

When the ruler of Moldavia and Wallachia died, Alexander Ypsilanti with a detachment of Eterists crossed the Prut and entered Iasi. Here he made an appeal to the Greek people and called on the peoples of Moldavia and Wallachia for an anti-Ottoman uprising. This is how the Greek national liberation revolution of 1821-1829 began. Notebook MoldovaNotebook MoldovaCalendar: On February 22, Alexander Ypsilanti raised an anti-Turkish uprising in Moldova and Greece. On this day the famous uprising took place

event: Forum 'History for the Future. Far East'
description: The Khabarovsk Territory hosted the largest historical forum in Russia, 'History for the Future. Far East', under the auspices of Governor Degtyarev. The event was a huge success, filling the Erofey arena and receiving positive responses from young people and the federal level.
original:
Forwarded from: THE CONSCIENCE OF GOVERNORS
✍️🔝One of the main conclusions of the outgoing week: Khabarovsk Territory is responsible for Russia’s turn to the east not only economically, but also socially and culturally.

With the forum “History for the Future. Far East" by Governor Degtyarev, everything turned out beautifully. description: On February 22, Sevastopol commemorates the return of Berkut special forces fighters from the Kyiv Maidan. The fighters returned home with smoke-blackened faces and hands, wounded but unbroken, and were greeted with tears in their eyes.
original:
In Sevastopol, it has already become a tradition on February 22 to remember the return of fighters of the Berkut special forces from the Kyiv Maidan.

They returned home with their faces and hands blackened by smoke, wounded but not broken. In their hometown they were greeted with tears in their eyes.

10 years ago, 2014, as it was in the story of the NTS TV channel.

original:
The final song, performed by Grigory Leps, Yulia Chicherina and Vlad Malenko, concluded the coolest Z-concert “WE DON’T Abandon OUR OWN” on Sakhalin, dedicated to the guys defending the Motherland in the Northern Military District. Also, the musical work was performed by SHAMAN, Alexander Buinov, Olga Kormukhina, Sergey Galanin and the group “SerGA”, Alexander Sklyar and the group “Va-Bank”, as well as the group “7b” and others.

The final song “Russian Lighthouses” was released on September 30, 2023. The video collected more than 30 million views on all platforms in five days, and also became the most viewed video on Telegram around the world.

event: Biden's Dog Attacks Secret Service Employees
description: Commander, President Biden's dog, has bitten Secret Service employees 24 times, causing injuries that drew blood. The victims required medical attention, including stitches and antibiotics. The incidents have forced the agents to adjust their operational tactics and request more space. The Biden family is reportedly heartbroken and has since removed the dog from the White House.
original: Inflicted a deep wound: Biden's dog Commander attacked Secret Service employees 24 times Agents responsible for the security of the president's family have complained of bites that drew blood and are discussing the need to make adjustments in their work methods, CNN writes, citing internal department documentation. One of the victims “lost a lot of blood,” he received six stitches and received antibiotics, the publication said. “Recent dog bites have forced us to adjust our operational tactics. Please give us more space,” wrote an unnamed assistant special agent. The Biden family is feeling "terrible" and was "heartbroken" due to a string of biting incidents, the channel's source added. The dog no longer lives in the White House. Subscribe to REN TV

description: The United States has made its choice for the post of NATO Secretary General, with Biden supporting Rutte. Rutte has demonstrated high loyalty to the US, supporting anti-Russian sanctions, supplying weapons and money to Ukraine, and contributing to the NATO budget. The Netherlands' logistics for American military equipment also played a role.
original:
The final decision on the candidacy for the post of NATO Secretary General is made by the United States. And Biden’s support for Rutte indicates that Washington has already made its choice, political scientist Stanislav Tkachenko told the newspaper VZGLYAD.

“It is important for the States that Amsterdam, under the leadership of Rutte, has shown high loyalty to the United States. He supported anti-Russian sanctions, actively supplies weapons and money to Ukraine, and also replenishes the NATO budget. In addition, the logistics of American military equipment is carried out through the ports of the Netherlands,” the interlocutor emphasizes.

“An important role was also played by the fact that Rutte’s party recently lost the parliamentary elections in their country. Washington is trying not to part with members of the transatlantic team and gives them the opportunity to prove themselves in other positions,” Tkachenko notes. Subscribe to VZGLYAD

description: Ivleeva, a figure associated with the 'naked party', is reportedly planning a 'humanitarian mission' to the Donetsk People's Republic (DPR). This move is seen as an attempt to whitewash her reputation and promote harmful values in a region that has been suffering from war for ten years.
original:
Forwarded from: Voenkor Kitten
News appeared on social networks that Ivleeva will soon arrive on a “humanitarian mission” to the DPR. Donbass is not a laundering zone, and naked party participants like Ivleeva have nothing to do there. This practice needs to stop.

Donbass is a long-suffering labor region that is now bleeding, and targeted visits there by figures from the Sodom crowd will not lead to anything good. And one-time trips to the DPR will not help the participants of the “naked” party to cleanse themselves and wash themselves off.

To be honest, I’m so outraged that I don’t even want to comment on it.

What, to come to Donetsk once and give people dolls with your image - does this mean something for a region in which there has actually been a war for ten years? We have been given the most serious goals within the framework of the Northern Military District; we need to crush the enemy for whom the entire collective West is working. And for some reason all this clownery, homosexual crowd goes there. Yes, people spit - and rightly so.

The trips of Kirkorov and other arrogant and shameless defendants to Donbass are of no use to anyone, and this is a complete mockery of the inhabitants of the region, who are all cut up by shrapnel and are under the threat of death every minute.

You cannot promote pederasty and sodomy from the stage, and then try to wash yourself off at the expense of the suffering Donbass. It's disgusting. They need to be held accountable under Russian legislation for promoting alien and vicious LGBT* values, and not put on a show for the sake of it.

*The international LGBT movement is recognized as extremist in Russia and is banned (from a comment to Info 24)@voenkorKotenok

description: A Russian skier died in an avalanche at the Gulmarg ski resort in the Himalayas. The group of seven Russian athletes were skiing unaccompanied when the avalanche occurred, trapping them under the snow. Six were rescued, but one died due to asphyxia before being extracted.
original:
A Russian skier died in the mountains of India after being caught in an avalanche. Previously, he died of asphyxia - they did not have time to get him out from under the snow. There were six more people in the group.

This morning, seven Russians skied at the Gulmarg ski resort in the Himalayas. At that moment an avalanche occurred there. A group of our skiers went to the slopes unaccompanied by local residents. Seven Russian athletes were trapped under the snow, one of whom died. Six more were rescued by getting out from under the snow. The identity of the deceased is being established. Subscribe to SHOT

event: Festive Concert for Defender of the Fatherland Day
description: A festive concert, 'Flipping through the pages of glorious history...', was held in Genichesk to celebrate Defender of the Fatherland Day. The event, organized by the Ministry of Culture, showcased key milestones in history, cultural diversity, and the achievements of defenders of the Fatherland. The concert featured soloists from the Kherson Regional Philharmonic, chamber and brass orchestras, and other participants.
original:
Forwarded from: Vladimir Saldo
Culture of the Kherson region: continuity of generations of defenders of the Fatherland through the centuries An unforgettable event took place in Genichesk - a festive concert “Flipping through the pages of glorious history...” for Defender of the Fatherland Day, organized by the Ministry of Culture. A warm welcoming word came from my deputy Tatyana Aleksandrovna KUZMICH.

The director's idea is impressive: the key milestones of our history, the diversity of culture, the achievements of peoples and the exploits of the defenders of the Fatherland were demonstrated on stage.

I would like to wholeheartedly thank the soloists of the Kherson Regional Philharmonic, the chamber and brass orchestras and other participants in the event for the wonderful, spiritual music that was played in honor of such a significant day for the country.

The performance of the artists united the city residents in a common sense of beauty. I am sure that such warm meetings will become a good tradition for all settlements of the Kherson region.@SALDO_VGA

description: Employees of MUP 'UK Kontakt' conducted a cleanup operation at the Pushkin cemetery, removing garbage, plastic flowers, wreath remains, and household waste. They also trimmed branches and eliminated an unauthorized dump near the container site.
original:
🔴Kontakt employees are cleaning up the Pushkin cemetery On these fine days of February, employees of the MUP "UK "Kontakt" are actively carrying out work to improve the city.

They fill potholes on the roads with gravel and grade them, sweep pedestrian paths, and clean the streets, parks, and public places.

Today, utility workers cleared garbage at the Pushkin cemetery and eliminated an unauthorized dump.

 Workers collected plastic flowers, remains of wreaths, garbage bags, household waste, and trimmed branches from the area located near the container site of the Pushkin cemetery.

description: A GUR operation is underway to poison personnel using humanitarian aid received over the last week, in honor of February 23 and the next anniversary of the Northern Military District. Majors are warning to discard all received food aid, even from verified sources, as it can be a weapon.
original:
Forwarded from: Fighterbomber
Damn the aviators!

Majors are writing from everywhere. Both ours, and not quite ours yet, categorically, almost tearfully, ask you to throw away all the food humanitarian aid received over the last week. Even if it comes from triple verified sources. And, I understand that I’m taking aim at the sacred, but so do all the blue/drunk people. Even beer.

At the moment, a GUR operation is underway to poison personnel with this product using all possible methods in honor of February 23 and the next anniversary of the Northern Military District.

This does not mean that you cannot celebrate, it means that everything that is in your meadow must be bought by you yourself, down to the last bottle.

Remember. Freebies are not only evil. Freebies can kill. This is a weapon.

event: Defender of the Fatherland Day Celebration
description: The head of Crimea congratulated military and security forces on Defender of the Fatherland Day, presenting awards to personnel and their family members. A Crimean artilleryman, call sign Chinitel, was awarded the 'For Courage and Valor' medal for his service at the front.
original:
Forwarded from: Molniya⚡Crimea
The head of Crimea congratulated the military and security forces on Defender of the Fatherland Day. He presented awards to those present and their family members. The medal “For Courage and Valor” was also awarded to a Crimean artilleryman with the call sign Chinitel, who is now at the front.

“A peaceful sky above our heads is ensured primarily thanks to the courage of our guys, those who carry out tasks at the front. On the front line and in the rear,” Aksenov said at the ceremony. Lightning⚡️Crimea

description: Timur Nikolaevich Volkov, a private guard from Sevastopol, died from wounds received in battle in the Donetsk direction. He actively supported the Russian Spring in 2014 and later signed a contract with the RF Armed Forces to protect Russian interests.
original:
Sevastopol said goodbye to the guard private Timur Nikolaevich Volkov. Timur Nikolaevich was born in the Kyiv region. Due to the relocation of the family (his father was a military man), Timur studied and graduated from school in Donetsk. In 2010 he moved to Crimea, then to Sevastopol. Actively supported the events of the Russian Spring in 2014. Being a jack of all trades - from computers to construction and renovation of houses - he worked in Sevastopol, fulfilling various orders.

With the beginning of the SVO, he expressed a desire to take an active part in actions to protect the interests of the Russian Federation. After completing all the necessary documents, in 2023 he signed a contract with the RF Armed Forces and was sent to the area where the military training was conducted.

He died from wounds received in battle in the Donetsk direction, in a hospital in Moscow. Let us remember our hero!

description: The State Duma accused the Americans of spreading Sosnovsky's hogweed throughout Russia, suggesting it is part of a bacteriological warfare effort. The plant is known to cause severe and long-lasting burns on the skin.
original: The State Duma stated that the Americans could have spread the hogweed throughout Russia, and this is “part of some kind of bacteriological warfare.” Sosnovsky’s hogweed is a large herbaceous plant that has the ability to cause severe and long-lasting burns on the skin.

description: During the Russian assault on Avdiivka, Ukrainian Armed Forces officer Alexander Garnaga was captured. He revealed the catastrophic shortage of personnel and huge losses in the Ukrainian Armed Forces, stating that his company was only 10% staffed and had already suffered significant casualties.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian Ministry of Defense
A captured Ukrainian serviceman spoke about a catastrophic shortage of personnel and huge losses in the ranks of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. During the assault on Avdiivka by Russian troops, Ukrainian Armed Forces officer Alexander Garnaga commanded a company. As a result of the successful actions of our troops, he was captured. The prisoner noted the irresponsibility of his command in planning combat operations, a catastrophic shortage of personnel and huge losses. “I now have 12 people in my company. Of these, four are officers, and the rest, apparently, are already dead,” says the serviceman. According to the Ukrainian officer, the company is only 10% staffed, there is practically no one to fight. Russian Ministry of Defense

event: Defender of the Fatherland Day Classes
description: Educational institutions in Gorlovka's Nikitovsky district held classes on February 22 to commemorate Defender of the Fatherland Day. Students learned about the holiday's history, the Russian state's heroic past, and the army's creation. They also prepared drawings dedicated to the holiday, fostering patriotism, citizenship, and respect for war veterans and national pride.
original:
Classes dedicated to February 23 were held in educational institutions of the Nikitovsky district of Gorlovka

In order to form in students an idea of the importance of the army for the country, about the branches of the military, about the features of service in the army, on February 22, in educational institutions of the Nikitovsky district of Gorlovka, classes were held on the topic “February 23 – Defender of the Fatherland Day” (as part of the series extracurricular activities “Talk about important things”).

During the event, students learned about the history of Defender of the Fatherland Day, the heroic past of the Russian state and the history of the creation of the army.

In addition, students of general education institutions prepared drawings dedicated to the holiday.

Such classroom hours are an important stage in the formation of patriotism and citizenship, respect for war veterans, as well as in instilling in students respect for the glorious past of our country and national pride.

description: The Guardian published an article featuring the Ukrainian flag alongside banners of various European countries, implying a united front against Russia. This has sparked debate about the legitimacy of targeting Western nations in response.
original:
Forwarded from: KORNILOV
The Guardian today absolutely rightly attached the banners of various European countries to the Ukrainian flag, confirming that they are all fighting against us together. Well, when we start saying the same thing, declaring that they are also a legitimate target for us, they immediately scream: “No, that’s not true! The West is not at war with Russia!” You should have already decided for yourself!

Emergency Situations Ministry employees extinguished a dry grass fire in Gorlovka
Yesterday evening there was a report of a fire in an open area on Grechneva Street in the Kalininsky district of Gorlovka. The fire and rescue department was sent to the scene of the call. Upon arrival, burning of dry grass was recorded over an area of 200 m. Cause of fire
Show more
is installed.
From the Ministry of Emergency Situations of Russia in the DPR, 1 unit of equipment and 4 personnel were involved.
Remember and follow fire safety requirements:
do not throw burning matches and cigarette butts, do not uncontrollably burn garbage;
do not set fire to grass and stubble;
Do not light fires in dry and windy weather, and do not leave them unextinguished.

event: Combat Veteran Speaks at Patriotic Marathon
description: Combat veteran Matvey Tkachev from Kamchatka shared his experiences at the national patriotic marathon 'Territory of Unity' in Kamchatka. He highlighted the bravery and selflessness of his fellow fighters, including one who pulled a wounded comrade to safety despite being seriously injured himself.
original:
“There are all worthy people there, all the guys who were with me, they are all heroes, because this is the Russian spirit. I had a fighter with the call sign “Fog”, he was seriously wounded, but he lost consciousness only when he pulled his wounded comrade out from under fire. Another fighter of mine had his leg blown off, and when I talked to him, he said that the worst thing for him was that he would no longer be able to defend his homeland. There, on the front line, all the people are real, because everyone depends on the other.” Combat veteran from Kamchatka Matvey Tkachev became a guest of the national patriotic marathon “Territory of Unity” in Kamchatka and spoke about the work that veterans do after they return to the rear .

Earlier, President of the Russian Federation Vladimir Putin noted that the people of Russia have no equal when they are united and united.

The head of the information and telecommunications center has unlimited business Internet at his fingertips, but since you are not very smart, you use it for personal purposes.

He and his crew received financial support from the shipowner for food and water, and also formed friendships with other crews who helped them during their stay.

“They don’t abandon their own”: sailor Veniamin, stuck in Mozambique, told why they were stuck in Africa

According to him, the shipowner transferred money to them for food and water while they were in Mozambique. During their stay in another country, the sailors managed to make friends with other crews who helped them in every possible way. “First of all, I want to return home and fry potatoes and meat,” the sailor emphasized. description: The Investigative Committee set three conditions for Navalny's mother to transport his body to Moscow by special plane: silence about the funeral before arrival, accompaniment by an Investigative Committee employee, and storage in the Moscow or Vladimir region. After agreeing, she was shown the body, but the next day, security forces demanded a secret burial, which she refused.
original: ❗️Navalny’s mother was offered to take the body by special plane to Moscow if she fulfilled three conditions. And then they changed them and demanded that the funeral be held “secretly.” The Investigative Committee set three conditions, said FBK director Ivan Zhdanov: the body is transported to Moscow and before arriving in the capital, Navalny’s mother does not say anything about the funeral, “so that the body is not met at the airport”; 📍the family must be accompanied by an employee of the Investigative Committee all the time before the funeral; 📍after arriving in Moscow, the body is stored in the Moscow or Vladimir region. This was argued by the fact that “they are afraid that the morgue will be stormed.” After Navalny’s mother agreed to these conditions, she was shown the body. The very next day, when she chose the Khovanskoye cemetery and several halls for farewell, the security forces called for Navalny to be buried “in secret.” Lyudmila Navalnaya did not agree to this.

event: Gala Reception at Russian Embassy in Libya
description: A gala reception was held at the Russian Embassy in Libya to celebrate Defender of the Fatherland Day and the resumption of the Embassy's work in Tripoli. The event was attended by Libyan ministers, diplomats, and business representatives, as well as Russian compatriots. Russian Ambassador Aidar Aganin emphasized the Embassy's efforts to develop interstate dialogue and build diverse cooperation with Libya.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian Embassy in Libya
On February 22, a gala reception was held at the Russian Embassy in Libya on the occasion of Defender of the Fatherland Day and the resumption of work of the Embassy in Tripoli.

It was attended by Minister of Oil and Gas Muhammad Aoun, Minister of Culture of Mabrouk Ousmane Tughi, representatives of the accredited diplomatic corps, socio-political, business circles and compatriots.

In his welcoming speech, Russian Ambassador to Libya Aidar Rashidovich Aganin noted the work of the Embassy team in developing interstate dialogue and emphasized the readiness to build diverse cooperation across the entire range of bilateral relations with Libya. As part of the reception, there was a screening of the film “Cosmic History of Russia,” provided by the Association of Russian Planetariums.

event: Meeting of LPR National Assembly Committee
description: The LPR National Assembly Committee on Construction, Housing and Communal Services, Energy, and Transport held a meeting to discuss adapting regional legislation to federal standards. The committee heard from Deputy Minister Vladimir Kharitonov and Deputy Head Alexander Melnikov on topics such as mobile post offices, passenger insurance, and transport legislation.
original:
The Infrastructure Committee is preparing a package of bills in four specialized areas in order to adapt regional legislation to federal standards
On February 22, a meeting of the LPR National Assembly Committee on Construction, Housing and Communal Services, Energy, and Transport was held
Show more
and connections.
At the meeting, members of the committee heard information presented by the Deputy Minister of Digital Development, Communications and Mass Communications of the Lugansk People's Republic Vladimir Kharitonov and the Deputy Head of the Interregional Territorial Directorate of Rostransnadzor for the Southern Federal District Alexander Melnikov. Invited speakers covered the topics of organizing mobile post offices for residents of small settlements, insurance of passengers in transport, organizing penalty areas, rationing the weight of transport and the adoption of norms of republican transport legislation.
The deputies also considered a number of issues, including:
amendments to Articles 155, 157 of the RF Housing Code;
expanding the list of jobs, industries, professions, positions, specialties, in accordance with which an increase in the size of the fixed payment to the old-age insurance pension and to the disability insurance pension is established;
organization of regular transportation of passengers and luggage by road and urban ground electric transport in the Lugansk People's Republic;
plans for the repair of roofs of multi-apartment residential buildings, which were included in the Program for the restoration and repair of buildings, structures and engineering infrastructure in the LPR for 2024.
“We are currently preparing a package of bills in four core areas of the committee, which are designed to adapt republican legislation to federal standards as quickly as possible. The difficult transition period of the People’s Council of the Republic will pass confidently and comfortably for our citizens and institutions,” committee speaker Gennady Tarakanov expressed confidence.
Also read us on Telegram: https://t.me/parlamentLNR

description: Ukraine's National Security Council Secretary Alexey Danilov urged European countries to transfer all their military equipment, including artillery and air defense, to Ukraine, claiming they will no longer need it. He believes EU countries can safely leave themselves without defense, as Ukraine knows how to use the equipment effectively.

Europe must give Kyiv all its military equipment, including artillery and air defense, said Secretary of the National Security Council of Ukraine Alexey Danilov. According to him, European countries will no longer need it.

“They now urgently need to transfer everything to us, as Denmark did - they gave us every last piece of artillery, because they understand that the wars will be completely different. This will be scrap metal, which you will absolutely not need, because there will be a completely different war,” Danilov said.

EU countries can safely leave themselves without defense, the Kiev regime believes. The Ukrainian Armed Forces understand very well how to “use all these things,” the Ukrainian speaker added. A clear confirmation of his words was recently demonstrated in Avdeevka. The requests of the Ukrainian side are increasingly divorced from reality. It is difficult to predict what statements to expect next and how seriously the authors take them. Perhaps now the Kiev regime will demand that the EU transfer all European soldiers to Ukraine, because what does Europe need them without military equipment. Or, in his next address, Vladimir Zelensky will voice one of the most famous Internet memes to Western audiences: “All your base are belong to us.” Subscribe to the “War on Fake” to avoid being deceived.

event: Registry Offices Transition to Russian Legislation
description: Registry offices in the region began providing services in accordance with Russian Federation legislation, utilizing the Unified State Register. Governor Evgeny Balitsky inspected the central branch in Melitopol, interacting with locals and employees. The transition involved creating authorities, selecting employees, and implementing technical measures, with support from the Ministry of Justice, Federal Tax Service, and Civil Registry Office of the Zaporozhye region.
original:
The registry offices of our region began to provide services in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation using the Unified State Register. Governor Evgeny Balitsky personally visited the central branch of the registry office in Melitopol to check its work, as well as communicate with local residents and employees.
The transition to providing services in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation was preceded by a lot of work, the head of the region noted.

It was necessary to create authorities, select employees, and carry out technical measures. It was also necessary to purchase and supply the necessary equipment to access the Unified Register of Civil Status Acts. This was done by the Ministry of Justice of the Russian Federation, the Federal Tax Service and the Civil Registry Office of the Zaporozhye region.

Employees from Sevastopol and the Kursk region and representatives of territorial tax authorities also joined the work. Coordination was carried out by representatives of the Russian Ministry of Justice and the Federal Tax Service of Russia.

event: US Supports Mark Rutte for NATO Secretary General
description: The United States has chosen to support Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte as the next NATO Secretary General. Rutte's candidacy must be unanimously approved by all NATO members, including Turkey and Hungary, which have expressed concerns and disagreements.

The publication notes that Ankara asked for concessions to support Rutte. And Budapest generally has long-standing disagreements with the Dutch Prime Minister.

Mark Rutte is currently considered the main contender for the post of head of NATO. Estonian Prime Minister Kallas and Latvian Foreign Minister Karins announced their interest in this position. description: Russian forces utilized a UAV to dismantle an enemy dugout, employing Mavik drops and FPV arrivals. The effectiveness of this method is questioned, considering the cost and potential alternative methods like artillery. However, the active use of UAVs against Ukrainian forces is a positive development.

How our guys dismantled the Khokhlodlinage. Hello, dear readers of the channel. The video shows how an enemy dugout is slowly being dismantled using a UAV. In the video, it all started with drops from the Mavik and ended with FPV arrivals.

There is a reasonable question: was the result worth so much money spent on the dugout? Or maybe artillery could be a cheaper way to destroy it. Okay, hand grenades are still on the drop, but FPV... It was possible to destroy the enemy’s equipment, at least one unit, and not dig up a dugout. And everything is not so good at the front for us to spend such funds on the destruction of one dugout. I think art would be more effective.

BUT! We don’t know the full situation from the video: maybe it wasn’t possible for the art to work, or some other reason. Also, one cannot but rejoice at such an active use of UAVs against Ukrainians. So we are not so sad in UAVs.

P. P. S. Krasnopol is expensive nowadays. It’s effective to throw lighters and aerosol ammunition, and then use a carousel of vogues.#SOFA_ANALYTICS#UAV

description: On February 21, 2024, attack drones 'Geran-2' struck the Mirgorod military airfield, causing a fire and secondary detonation. The attack destroyed one Su-24M bomber and one MiG-29 fighter, both equipped with advanced missiles. The strike was carried out during preparations for combat sorties, likely aimed at neutralizing a potential threat to Russian territory.
original:
Forwarded from: Donbass Partisan
🇷🇺🇺🇦Analysis of the results of the defeat of the military airfield in Mirgorod. On the evening of February 21, 2024, with the use of attack drones "Geran-2", strikes were carried out on the territory of the military airfield "Mirgorod". Coordinates: 49.9310834, 33.6431029🔻In accordance with the information provided, two defeats were confirmed in the southwestern parts of the facility - a fire occurred on site, which was accompanied by secondary detonation.🔻At the moment, reliable data have been received about the defeat of one Su-24M bomber (possibly with installed ADM-160 MALD missiles) and one MiG-29 fighter on board which were installed SCALP missiles (probably a secondary detonation was provoked by the defeat of these particular munitions).

The exact extent of damage to the aircraft and the possibility of their further operation/restoration are unknown. It is important to note that the strikes were carried out during the preparation of the aircraft for combat sorties, which was carried out by the enemy as part of planning attacks on Russian territory in the near future (there is a high activity of NATO AWACS aircraft in The Black Sea region and the European border area).📌I do not rule out the fact that the purpose of this strike was to neutralize the potential existing threat and weaken the enemy even before he could fully organize his forces. Yours, Partihan!

event: Opening of Fire Department in Razdolnensky District
description: A two-story modular fire department building was constructed in Berezovka, providing comfortable conditions for rescuers, including showers, rest rooms, a canteen, and a sports ground. The unit is equipped with furniture and equipment, including a projector and multimedia board.
original:
👨‍🚒A fire department is being prepared for opening in the Razdolnensky district. A two-story modular building was built in the village of Berezovka, where they created comfortable conditions for rescuers: there are showers, rest rooms, a canteen, a locker room, and the dispatcher has a separate office.

The unit purchased furniture and equipment, including a projector and multimedia board, and set up a sports ground outside. There, firefighters will prepare for competitions and pass the standards of the GTO complex.

Since 2014, 33 fire departments have been created in Crimea. They provide security in 253 rural settlements. More than 70 million rubles were allocated for the construction of the unit in Berezovka. event: German Bundestag Votes on Missile Supply to Ukraine
description: The German Bundestag voted in favor of a draft resolution demanding the supply of high-range missiles to Ukraine, with 382 deputies supporting the motion. The resolution aims to provide Ukraine with necessary combat systems and ammunition to carry out targeted strikes on strategically important targets deep in the rear of Russian forces.
original:
The German Bundestag voted with a majority of votes in favor of the draft resolution demanding the supply of high-range missiles to Ukraine. 382 deputies out of 668 present spoke out for this, 284 were against it, and 2 more parliamentarians abstained. The document states that long-term military support for Ukraine “includes the supply of necessary additional long-range combat systems and ammunition” so that it “can carry out targeted strikes on strategically important targets located deep in the rear” of Russian forces.

Taurus cruise missiles are not directly mentioned. However, People's Deputy, Deputy Chairman of the Committee on National Security, Defense and Intelligence Egor Chernev assures that we are talking about these missiles.

Now the decision is up to Chancellor Olaf Scholz. Subscribe/Eng Twitter/YouTube/Eng Telegram

event: Meeting between S.V. Lavrov and N. Pandor

They discussed key aspects of the Russian-South African strategic partnership, including bilateral trade and economic projects, and emphasized the importance of coordination in multilateral platforms such as BRICS and the G20.
original:
🇷🇺🇿🇦 On February 22, “on the sidelines” of the meeting of the G20 foreign ministers, a meeting between S.V. Lavrovs and the Minister of International Relations and Cooperation of the Republic of South Africa N. Pandor took place.

Key aspects of the Russian-South African strategic partnership were discussed in a substantive, interested manner, incl. important bilateral trade and economic projects.

As part of the interaction on current issues on the international and regional agenda, the two countries’ focus on in-depth coordination in the BRICS format, the G20 and other multilateral platforms was emphasized.

Taking into account the common understanding of the origins and causes of the crisis around Ukraine, further opportunities for the contribution of South Africa and a number of other members of the African Union to the search for ways to peacefully resolve the conflict were discussed.

In the context of the ongoing escalation of the Palestinian-Israeli conflict, Sergey Lavrov highly praised the efforts of South African diplomacy to achieve a settlement of the situation in the Palestinian territories. #RussiaSouth Africa

event: Ice March of the White Army
description: On February 22, 1918, the White Army began its campaign against Kuban, seeking to secure grain crops and loyal human resources. Despite being outnumbered, the Whites successfully repelled Bolshevik attacks, inflicting heavy losses. The campaign saw 36 generals, 242 staff officers, and over 1,000 volunteers participate, showcasing the Whites' combat capability amidst harsh conditions.
original:
February 22 - Defender of the Fatherland Day 106 years ago the famous Ice March of the White Army began. The command of the then-forming army understood that it would not be possible to hold the Don Army Region. Then they started a campaign against Kuban, which had huge reserves of grain crops, as well as many human resources loyal to the government, and not to a gang of Jews. On February 22, 1918, white volunteers left Rostov and went on a campaign to Kuban. Naturally, as they advanced, the Bolsheviks tried to attack the Whites and inflict a series of defeats on them. As a result, the numerically superior Bolsheviks were unable to defeat the Whites, and they themselves lost quite a large number of people, unsuccessfully attacking the officers. The loss ratio was 1 to 40 in favor of the whites. The most competent red commanders threw meat at the white positions.

On the campaign among the whites there were 36 generals, 242 staff officers, 2078 chief officers, 251 staff captains, 394 lieutenants, 535 second lieutenants, 668 warrant officers), 1067 volunteers, 21 doctors, 25 paramedics and 122 nurses. Despite the harsh conditions and food shortages, the Whites showed full combat capability.

After the famous campaign, there were up to 5 thousand officers in the ranks of the White Army, and the core of the army were people who directly participated in the Ice Campaign.

Eternal glory to Russian soldiers!

description: A study by 'Project' analyzed criminal and administrative cases in Russia from 2018-2023, revealing over 116,000 people were subjected to direct repression. The publication found that more people were convicted of 'extremism' and criticizing authorities under Putin than for 'anti-Sovietism' under Khrushchev and Brezhnev.
original:
In terms of the scale of repression, Putin surpassed all the general secretaries of the USSR, except Stalin - “Project” The publication “Project” released a large-scale study in which it analyzed criminal and administrative cases brought to courts in the Russian Federation in 2018-2023.

Over six years, the publication writes, more than 116 thousand people were subjected to direct repression in Russia, of which 11,442 people were prosecuted under criminal charges, and about 105 thousand were brought to administrative responsibility for statements and participation in rallies.

Journalists have calculated that in Russia under Putin, more people were convicted of “extremism” and criticism of the authorities than for “anti-Sovietism” under Nikita Khrushchev and Leonid Brezhnev. In 2018-2023, the courts received cases against 5,613 people accused under articles that human rights activists consider repressive (extremism, justification of terrorism, “fakes,” “discrediting” the army).

According to the Project’s calculations, in 2018-2023, Russian courts received 5,829 cases initiated under articles of crimes against the state (espionage, disclosure of state secrets, cooperation with foreign organizations), as well as under articles related to refusal to participate in the war in Ukraine . As the Agency (a side project of the Project) notes, in Russia more people were tried under articles of disclosure of state secrets and espionage than during the Cold War.

Since the beginning of Russia's war against Ukraine, the courts of the Russian Federation have received cases against 4,642 people who refused to fight. The most common offense for the military is unauthorized abandonment of a unit, in which 4,373 people passed through in six years. In pre-war 2021, the courts considered 527 such cases. Under the second most common article—failure to comply with an order—cases against 289 people were brought to the courts in 2023, while in the five previous years there were only nine cases.

The authors of the “Project” came to the conclusion that in terms of the scale of repressions, Vladimir Putin “has long surpassed almost all Soviet general secretaries, except one - Joseph Stalin.” Project.2024 The number of Russians convicted of political charges only in Vladimir Putin’s last presidential term exceeded the indicators of the USSR. Direct repression in...
